[{'created': '2018-04-04 00:00:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert method for batch member update

The create/delete reverts worked because the old/new member lists were
simply db object lists, but the update list is tuples of (obj, dict) and
need a little bit of massaging.

Change-Id: I423f9a679c161b11cf51337717e4e7e73d71a1b3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revert method for batch member update

The create/delete reverts worked because the old/new member lists were
simply db object lists, but the update list is tuples of (obj, dict) and
need a little bit of massaging.

Change-Id: I423f9a679c161b11cf51337717e4e7e73d71a1b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 17:25:43.000000000', 'message': "Add Windows volume backup support

This patch makes a few small changes that are required in order to
have the Cinder Backup service working on Windows.

- all physial disks must be open in byte mode. 'rb+' must be used
when writing.
- reading passed the disk size boundary will not return an empty
string, raising an IOError instead. For this reason, we're avoiding
doing it.
- we ensure that the chunk size is a multiple of the sector size.
- the chmod command is not available on Windows. Although changing
owners is possible, it is not needed. For this reason, the
'temporary_chown' helper will be a noop on Windows. It's easier to
do it here rather than do platform checks wherever this gets called.
- when connecting the volumes, we pass the 'expect_raw_disk' argument,
which provides a hint to the connector about what we expect. This
allows the SMBFS connector to return a mounted raw disk path instead
of a virtual image path.
- when the driver provides temporary snapshots to be used during
the backup process, the API is bypassed. For this reason, we need to
ensure that the snapshot state and progress gets updated accordingly.
Otherwise, this breaks the nova assisted snapshot workflow.

We're doing platform checks, ensuring that we don't break/change
the current workflow.

Implements: blueprint windows-smb-backup

Depends-On: #I20f791482fb0912772fa62d2949fa5becaec5675

Change-Id: I8769a135974240fdf7cebd4b6d74aaa439ba1f27
"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 17:27:57.000000000', 'message': "Add Windows volume backup support

- when the driver provides temporary snapshots to be used during

Otherwise, this breaks the nova assisted snapshot workflow.

commit_message:
Add Windows volume backup support

This patch makes a few small changes that are required in order to
have the Cinder Backup service working on Windows.

- all physial disks must be open in byte mode. 'rb+' must be used
when writing.
- reading passed the disk size boundary will not return an empty
string, raising an IOError instead. For this reason, we're avoiding
doing it.
- we ensure that the chunk size is a multiple of the sector size.
- the chmod command is not available on Windows. Although changing
owners is possible, it is not needed. For this reason, the
'temporary_chown' helper will be a noop on Windows. It's easier to
do it here rather than do platform checks wherever this gets called.
- when connecting the volumes, we pass the 'expect_raw_disk' argument,
which provides a hint to the connector about what we expect. This
allows the SMBFS connector to return a mounted raw disk path instead
of a virtual image path.
- when the driver provides temporary snapshots to be used during
the backup process, the API is bypassed. For this reason, we need to
ensure that the snapshot state and progress gets updated accordingly.
Otherwise, this breaks the nova assisted snapshot workflow.

We're doing platform checks, ensuring that we don't break/change
the current workflow.

The Swift and Posix backup drivers are known to be working on Windows.

Implements: blueprint windows-smb-backup

Depends-On: #I20f791482fb0912772fa62d2949fa5becaec5675

Change-Id: I8769a135974240fdf7cebd4b6d74aaa439ba1f27

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-08 20:03:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove max_microversion from compute keypairs test

This PS removes the max_microversion = 2.10 from compute
keypairs test because the API isn't deprecated. This is
probably a typo for min_microversion.

Neither the API documentation [0], nor the API code [1], nor
any other supporting documentation [2] suggests that the
os-keypairs API is deprecated in 2.11.

Since min_microversion = 2.10 is not needed, rather than fixing
the supposed typo, max_microversion is removed.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#keypairs-keypairs
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/keypairs.py
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html

Change-Id: I775565ca2586dd7c861e406abb46204ae0890bce
"}, {'created': '2018-04-08 20:04:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove max_microversion from compute keypairs test

commit_message:
Remove max_microversion from compute keypairs test

This PS removes the max_microversion = 2.10 from compute
keypairs test because the API isn't deprecated. This is
probably a typo for min_microversion.

Neither the API documentation [0], nor the API code [1], nor
any other supporting documentation [2] suggests that the
os-keypairs API is deprecated in 2.11.

Since min_microversion = 2.10 is not needed, rather than fixing
the supposed typo, max_microversion is removed.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#keypairs-keypairs
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/keypairs.py
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html

Partially Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api
Change-Id: I775565ca2586dd7c861e406abb46204ae0890bce

subject: Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-05 10:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-05 10:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-08 03:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-09 02:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:52:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not sure about this change yet. I've been wondering about an alternative where the original db gets renamed and the new db takes the name of the original e.g.

hash.db -> hash_timestamp.db (original, eventually deleted)
           hash.db (new)

the reason for this is that in [1] the plan is to shrink all the way back to the root, and that means that at some point the root may need to shard again, which in turn means:

- we can't rely on the db name to tell us sharding state
- we need whatever renaming pattern to be repeatable

I started some preliminary work in this direction in [2] which was an attempt to peel about the management of sharding state from presence or not of db files, but didn't get as far as implementing any changes to the db names.

[1] https://trello.com/c/SDCjvOyt/135-dont-delete-shards-when-marking-root-as-deleted
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527938/"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-04-08 23:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Now using the epoch naming scheme'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 10:09:07.000000000', 'message': "Use _root.db and _shard_db on sharded containers

This patch makes the naming of containers more operator friendly.
A sharding/sharded root container would create a <container>_root.db
to manage the shardranges. This signifies that it's a root container
to ops or anyone looking on disk.
When shards cleave, the sharding db that holds the cleaving shardranges
are called <container>_shard.db. Once a shard has completed sharding
the original db is unlinked, then the container is marked as deleted,
so these _shard.db files will be reclaimed.

This patch basically makes looking at the ondisk database files easier
to grok and understand.

Change-Id: Ib9dca9beb87a5a6bf267eb8373c32f7075e5bfcb
"}, {'created': '2018-01-08 03:01:20.000000000', 'message': "Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers

commit_message:
Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers

This patch makes the naming of containers more operator friendly.
A sharding/sharded root container would create a <container>_root.db
to manage the shardranges. This signifies that it's a root container
to ops or anyone looking on disk.
When shards cleave, the sharding db that holds the cleaving shardranges
are called <container>_shard.db. Once a shard has completed sharding
the original db is unlinked, then the container is marked as deleted,
so these _shard.db files will be reclaimed.

This patch basically makes looking at the ondisk database files easier
to grok and understand.

Change-Id: Ib9dca9beb87a5a6bf267eb8373c32f7075e5bfcb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 22:05:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't use -e to test for what might be broken symlink

The behavior of test -e and [[ -e against broken symlinks is to fail
even if the symlink exists. However we want to test if the link exists
or if there is a file in that location. Therefore switch from test -e to
test -L and test -f to check if the file or link exists regardless of
link target validity.

Change-Id: I84a9b6731eccf950707be50aef464a2de1e33e8e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use -e to test for what might be broken symlink

The behavior of test -e and [[ -e against broken symlinks is to fail
even if the symlink exists. However we want to test if the link exists
or if there is a file in that location. Therefore switch from test -e to
test -L and test -f to check if the file or link exists regardless of
link target validity.

Change-Id: I84a9b6731eccf950707be50aef464a2de1e33e8e

commit_message:
Add robust ldap domain-specific config

This patch set provides PATCH capability for ldap-backed domain config,
and prevents silent failure if the configuration contains erroneous
setting.  This also moves from loading .conf files into DB directly,
and uses the API endpoints.

Change-Id: I17a19046fa96e0f3e8fb029c156ba79c924a0097
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,
then we need to used the default defined in network/config/

Change-Id: If119f3900eb60a217b8209d59fb9bc900107addb
(cherry picked from commit ddc719299968644929a9b2cb0622500b5e9c4e65)

commit_message:
Rally: Install latest version

rally_pip_packages = ['/rally'] should be change to ['rally']
Otherwise rally is not the latest version
$ rally --version
0.10.1~dev137

And leading to create-verifier error
$ rally verify create-verifier --type tempest --name tempest-verifier
Failed to initialize testr.

According to Andrey, https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1751821
"rally>=0.11.1 should be used since
tempest 18 switched from using testrepository (testr) to stestr."

Fix '/rally' to 'rally' can install the latest version
$ rally --version
0.11.2

Change-Id: I511dac6969ebed03cb22a1b1dafe03d8dade3933

commit_message:
Pass whole selected entity to deleteEntity callback

For now, delete-modal service passes only ID to deleteEntity callback.
Some plugins need other parameters to delete entity.
So this patch passes whole selected entity to callback as second argument.

Change-Id: I395470110a5f03ebb08a043ca433b16b999dad3f
Needed-By: Ic5aba9b2e953cde7950ae7656cd5a3fee3f4a55c
Closes-Bug: #1761074

commit_message:
Use NOVA_BIN_DIR / SWIFT_BIN_DIR for binaries

Fix a few path issues where we didn't properly use NOVA_BIN_DIR /
SWIFT_BIN_DIR.

This is part of the effort to start using a virtualenv for openstack
services.

Change-Id: I6eb383db65cc902c67c43e5cb1a16a9716a914b2
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-08 07:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-08 07:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Topic move removed'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-04-08 09:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

What kind of RPC failures did you meet?

Exceptions/failures in the engine part can be handled by [1]. So I guess this change is aiming at the failures of the RPC stuff itself. If so, can we use try-except in the RPC client to set the execution's status to ERROR/FAILED upon failures?

With this change, an execution's status can keep being WAITING if something goes wrong in RPC. How could we deal with that?

A tempest test is failing, please investigate.

[1] I7e61602ab010bc1f64c63b98d3d70a86b01c95cb"}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-08 12:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-08 07:15:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add a wating status for execution

If rpc server failed when creating execution, the status of execution will
still keep running, while running status will effect concurrency in
``engine.default_engine.function_load_check``, but the execution does not
occupy any worker pods indeed. So a waiting status will be needed to
prevent rpc cast/call failures.

Change-Id: I617804fa47525f7f7c081475864b9ebfa96e91a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add a wating status for execution

If rpc server failed when creating execution, the status of execution will
still keep running, while running status will effect concurrency in
``engine.default_engine.function_load_check``, but the execution does not
occupy any worker pods indeed. So a waiting status will be needed to
prevent rpc cast/call failures.

Change-Id: I617804fa47525f7f7c081475864b9ebfa96e91a1

commit_message:
Add documention for setting up LDAP

Devstack supports deploying an LDAP server and configuring keystone
to use it, but we didn't have any documentation for it. This commit
adds some basic documentation that should help developers setup
LDAP-backed development environments.

Change-Id: I8ba07d73f52cb7f575ff2953977e9fdcade92d83

commit_message:
devstack: add kubelet iface to openshift nodes

OpenShift container probes in baremetal deployments are also necessary
as well as enabling routing to the service network for the OpenShift API
to be reachable by host networking pods.

Closes-Bug: 1757993
Change-Id: I73ab7d4ad660cb109ad3469c9a0ea0de35be8179
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-21 18:31:17.000000000', 'message': "devstack: Make service subnet routable

We currently have a pod subnet ovs internal port created in devstack.
This allows the kubelet to do the necessary container probes. The
problem is that if we run host networking pods that need to access the
API they won't be able to do it in the expected way (sending HTTP
requests to the clusterIP of the API).

This patch addresses it via routing, so the kubelet iface is used for
the service access.

Closes-Bug: 1743081
Change-Id: I899c925610b69affc5a43bc6ba8ecb8fdee67e90
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-03-21 20:37:20.000000000', 'message': "devstack: Make service subnet routable

This allows the kubelet to do the necessary container probes. The
problem is that if we run host networking pods that need to access the
API they won't be able to do it in the expected way (sending HTTP
requests to the clusterIP of the API).

This patch addresses it via routing, so the kubelet iface is used for

Closes-Bug: 1743081
Change-Id: I899c925610b69affc5a43bc6ba8ecb8fdee67e90

commit_message:
devstack: Make service subnet routable

We currently have a pod subnet ovs internal port created in devstack.
This allows the kubelet to do the necessary container probes. The
problem is that if we run host networking pods that need to access the
API they won't be able to do it in the expected way (sending HTTP
requests to the clusterIP of the API).

This patch addresses it via routing, so the kubelet iface is used for
the service access.

Closes-Bug: 1743081
Change-Id: I899c925610b69affc5a43bc6ba8ecb8fdee67e90
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Fix failure when adding a speaker to an agent

When get_bgp_speaker_with_advertised_routes() collects the data for BGP
peers, it needs to include the auth_type field, otherwise adding the
speaker to an agent will fail.

(cherry picked from commit fd497a491afec89d4a15cf061b5d5610fb7ad6d2)
Change-Id: I668397be4a531ba5c0628eb23df9a84d0de8c28c

Hi @Chenghui:

First of all excuse me if you already know this. To add a release note you need to go to your neutron-lib directory and type:
  neutron-lib$ reno new remove-ensure_dir

This will create a new file in neutron-lib/releasenotes/notes/remove-ensure_dir-xxxxxxxxxxxx

Then you need to add something like this: http://paste.openstack.org/show/623294/'}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-10-11 09:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2017-09-11 08:21:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix usage of ensure_dir

utils.file.ensure_dir is deprecated for removal in version Queens.
ensure_tree(path, 0o755) from oslo_utils.fileutils can be used instead.

Change-Id: Ibe07cf2aaefb26b198c7c8c98b59106c0c65db14
'}, {'created': '2017-10-09 00:47:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ensure_dir

commit_message:
Remove the ensure_dir

The utils.file.ensure_dir is deprecated for removal in version Ocata.
ensure_tree(path, 0o755) from oslo_utils.fileutils can be used
instead.

Change-Id: Ibe07cf2aaefb26b198c7c8c98b59106c0c65db14

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba

"}, {'created': '2018-03-29 09:24:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't use hypervisor_hostname as compute hostname

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba
Closes-Bug: #1759801
"}, {'created': '2018-03-30 06:57:08.000000000', 'message': "Don't use hypervisor_hostname as compute hostname

Several tempest tests are failing when using the VMware virt driver
where compute hostname != hypervisor_hostname. Those are different
things and cannot be used interchangeably. This patch fixes a
regression introduced with commit 1dc2e231 where the hosts_client was
replaced with hypervisor_client in order to select hosts which are both
up and enabled.

This patch changes the implementation of get_host_other_than() to use
services_client which still allows to select nova computes which are up
and enabled but also gives us the compute hostname.

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba
Closes-Bug: #1759801
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use hypervisor_hostname as compute hostname

Several tempest tests are failing when using the VMware virt driver
where compute hostname != hypervisor_hostname. Those are different
things and cannot be used interchangeably. This patch fixes a
regression introduced with commit 1dc2e231 where the hosts_client was
replaced with hypervisor_client in order to select hosts which are both
up and enabled.

This patch changes the implementation of get_host_other_than() to use
services_client which still allows to select nova computes which are up
and enabled but also gives us the compute hostname.

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba
Closes-Bug: #1759801

commit_message:
Use higher max memory for items in memcached

The default max memory is 64MB, which is too small for production
environment.

Change-Id: I72d87cd29762fe49ae4f711f092df655cea954a9
Closes-Bug: #1758286

Remove force value of get_url in playbook

According to the ansible docs[0], no is the default of force parameter
in get_url module after ansible 0.6.

This fixes a regression introduced with commit 88c7ea8 which replaced
list_hosts with list_hypervisors because the former is deprecated.
However, the hypervisor_hostname cannot be used as replacement for
compute hostname. This patch fixes the problem by switching to
list_services which returns compute hostnames.

Change-Id: I948429075e71e11e091703c4b12378c71c37bc29
'}]
commit_message:
Replace list_hypervisors with list_services

This fixes a regression introduced with commit 88c7ea8 which replaced
list_hosts with list_hypervisors because the former is deprecated.
However, the hypervisor_hostname cannot be used as replacement for
compute hostname. This patch fixes the problem by switching to
list_services which returns compute hostnames.

Change-Id: I948429075e71e11e091703c4b12378c71c37bc29

- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-puppet-nv http://logs.openstack.org/73/502373/2/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-puppet-nv/706507e/ : SUCCESS in 1h 58m 43s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2017-09-16 07:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

please change 'keystone' to 'ec2api' in the commit message.
and please tell me why cert is needed in the review"}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-09-16 08:43:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> please change 'keystone' to 'ec2api' in the commit message.
 > and please tell me why cert is needed in the review

Thank you very much! The format of the strings generated by isoformat() have a couple of problems, firstly, the strings generated by isotime are used in tokens and other public APIs that we can't change without a deprecation period. The strings generated by isoformat are not the same format, so we can't just change to it. Secondly, the strings generated by isoformat do not include the microseconds if the value happens to be 0. This will likely show up as random failures as parsers may be written to always expect microseconds, and it will parse correctly most of the time."}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-09-16 08:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2017-09-16 08:58:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've understood why we need this fix but I didn't understand why certificate is needed in this review"}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2017-09-21 12:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-09-22 03:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I've understood why we need this fix but I didn't understand why
 > certificate is needed in this review

Thank you very much! Would I remove those descriptions in the commit ?"}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-09-25 01:12:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I've understood why we need this fix but I didn't understand why
 > > certificate is needed in this review
 > 
 > Thank you very much! Would I remove those descriptions in the
 > commit ?

I think there are two reasons to add this method:
(1)The strings generated by isotime are used in tokens and other public APIs that we can't change without a deprecation period. The strings generated by isoformat are not the same format, so we can't just change to it.
(2)The strings generated by isoformat do not include the microseconds if the value happens to be 0. This will likely show up as random failures as parsers may be written to always expect microseconds, and it will parse correctly most of the time."}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-09-25 01:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-25 03:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-11 02:49:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6 so we need to stop using it.

The deprecation message says to use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to keystone.common.utils.isotime().

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: I33f8a59c0c6ff4ec53d6763b1548dbf9d906acac
Partial-Bug: #1461251

commit_message:
Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6.

The deprecation message says to use the datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to ec2api.api.ec2utils.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: I33f8a59c0c6ff4ec53d6763b1548dbf9d906acac
Partial-Bug: #1461251

commit_message:
Remove the usage of "to_dict()" method in _dictify_context

As RequestContext.get_logging_values() method has been defined for
logging context specific information in oslo.context, the to_dict() method is deprecated
for removal in version '5.0.0'

Change-Id: Ifd350651aad059d69f1ed309dcf6a0db0c37df62
Closes-Bug: #1715148

commit_message:
zun do not support multipath

When using multipath to mount the volume, In fact, it's still a single path
device, resulting in failure.

Change-Id: Ied2256164b56f1008db299f11ddee604acc09e6c
Closes-Bug: #1761106

commit_message:
Move /rename endpoint into patch

Currently, we have an endpoint (POST /containers/<container>/rename)
for renaming container:
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L591

We should move this API into PATCH /containers/<container>
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L570)
because this is the convention of API design in OpenStack
(e.g. nova implements server rename at PUT /servers/<server>)

Depends-On: I0aeb155bc85f1dfbd436be1d39568b0f90ccf027
Change-Id: Ib92b0482b988641aa01f5648f108dc4c8690fa77
Closes-Bug: #1759459

commit_message:
[Trivial]Add coverage for extending non-blank volume

Now there is no coverage for extending non-blank volume,
and because this is a basic function that is often required
by cloud users, this is to make a trivial fix to cover it.

Change-Id: I10a409a423ec41a2092564a103b95e40c358c95e

[{'created': '2018-04-06 07:21:50.000000000', 'message': "Validate image_driver input

In the API endpoint of POST /containers , we take a
parameter 'image_drive' as an input
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L352).
It is better to validate if the inputted image driver
is within the image drivers list
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/conf/image_driver.py#L18)
configured by the cloud administrator. If the
input is invalid, Zun should reject the request.

Closes-Bug: #1758358

commit_message:
Validate image_driver input

In the API endpoint of POST /containers , we take a
parameter 'image_drive' as an input
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L352).
It is better to validate if the inputted image driver
is within the image drivers list
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/conf/image_driver.py#L18)
configured by the cloud administrator. If the
input is invalid, Zun should reject the request.

Change-Id: Id9479a137322279b3146c33fb065027aef1f1ff9
Closes-Bug: #1758358

commit_message:
Remove network_attach_strategy option

The network_attach_strategy conf option has not been used since [1]
merged in ocata, but was never cleaned up. This rectifies that.

[1] ebee3eae88a214ecf340e36b69dc8af8a609f6e9

Change-Id: I2047dfcdd8838859001264ce00b9c244607193b8

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It causes fail in
requirements-check.

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Iaa3c390d5c66bdbf5836a6d5d59bc5a636235722

commit_message:
Modified load_data to remove e.message reference

Changed load_data to not reference e.message when json.loads
raises a ValueError and added a couple of tests.

Also reversed the order of py27 and py34 in tox.ini to avoid
the issue caused by bug 1489059

Change-Id: I5ec716ef21ad0347189034da0aabbb54c9de0ede
Closes-Bug: 1762073

commit_message:
api-ref: document sorting parameters for networks

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch improves the documentation of these two
sorting parameters.

In particular, we explicitly list all the attributes that can be used
as a sort_key for network resource. This is necessary because the list
of sort_key varies across different resources and it is hard for
API users to guess which resource support which sort_key.

Change-Id: I5183bfe4c835dae0f0bfae61114e9b9be2877b0f

commit_message:
Rename Mistral notifier queue

In case there is an execute_mistral action in one of the templates, the
evaluator used to send an event to a queue with a 'mistral' topic.
This change adds a 'vitrage_notifier' prefix to the queue name, to make
it more clear that this is a Vitrage queue.

Change-Id: I23b5e43c931381cc4ec628659a1f1f250e308c82

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 02:39:36.000000000', 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)
"}]
commit_message:
Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)

commit_message:
Fix docker_registry_* variables for Periodic jobs

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545873/ docker
registry variables always set to "docker.io" for both
periodic and patch jobs because comparison of string
is done with integer which returns "false" always, this patch
fixes it.

Change-Id: Iea10d6bff3b0c0b3f440372326ec221d94e95838

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 09:06:42.000000000', 'message': "Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes

OVH nodepool nodes have an issue which causes nested virt
instances to crash with a hardware error, then a dump.
We therefore detect whether we're running on OVH and
force it to use qemu instead.

Change-Id: I54681092adf9c0647bf65583176ddc21c99494f3
(cherry picked from commit cc98ed84f166cc7dd09ff0157764b3f4d06391b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes

OVH nodepool nodes have an issue which causes nested virt
instances to crash with a hardware error, then a dump.
We therefore detect whether we're running on OVH and
force it to use qemu instead.

Change-Id: I54681092adf9c0647bf65583176ddc21c99494f3
(cherry picked from commit cc98ed84f166cc7dd09ff0157764b3f4d06391b6)

[{'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:48:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-04-06 17:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-04-07 05:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-07 07:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21728, 'date': '2018-04-07 07:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-04-07 07:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-07 11:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Default to docker.io instead of trunk.registry.rdoproject.org

Use trunk.registry.rdoproject.org for periodic (promotion) jobs
only, and docker.io for patch jobs.

Change-Id: I91aebe40667f6737fdf2676dd4e8030076c6eaa8

commit_message:
Use a pythonic delete, with a retry.

Replace an exec() of rm with a more pythonic thing, with a simple
retry loop now that we can't just use the one oslo gives us for
free. The retry delay is the same as that currently used by
oslo.

Change-Id: Icdd039bb4374269d9da38e7f8d2e15e05ca8aadb
blueprint: execs-ive-had-a-few

Add support for Debian system

1) Add server.pp for congress
2) Add hooks for external install & svc management
3) Add the acceptance test to deploy the service now

[{'created': '2018-03-28 22:24:30.000000000', 'message': "Spawn/stop metadata proxies upon adding/deleting router interfaces

When a network becomes isolated and isolated_metadata_enabled=True, the DHCP
agent won't spawn the required metadata proxy instance unless the agent gets
restarted. Similarly, it won't stop them when the network is no longer
isolated.

This patch fixes it by updating the isolated metadata proxy on port_update_end
and port_delete_end methods which are invoked every time a router interface
port is added, updated or deleted.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit b07aa19deb82604b954f323a76c70cc623601ca7)
"}]
commit_message:
Spawn/stop metadata proxies upon adding/deleting router interfaces

When a network becomes isolated and isolated_metadata_enabled=True, the DHCP
agent won't spawn the required metadata proxy instance unless the agent gets
restarted. Similarly, it won't stop them when the network is no longer
isolated.

This patch fixes it by updating the isolated metadata proxy on port_update_end
and port_delete_end methods which are invoked every time a router interface
port is added, updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I5c197a5755135357c6465dfe4803019a2ad52c14
Closes-Bug: #1753540
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from 9362d4f1f21df2a27c818bb0c2918241eb67e3d0)
(cherry picked from commit b07aa19deb82604b954f323a76c70cc623601ca7)

commit_message:
Don't log set_fact tasks for role_data

set_fact logs the fact value. In the case of reading the role_data_*
files, this is very verbose as the files can be large. Use no_log: True
to make these tasks less verbose. The content is saved in the
config-download output already, so no useful info is lost.

Change-Id: Ie6f75113194961628a0c9bdfbfbf5d88a18059eb
Closes-Bug: #1760996

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 02:38:57.000000000', 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)
"}]
commit_message:
Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)

commit_message:
Fix callback plugin for Ansible 2.5 compatability

Ansible 2.5 changed an internal callback method around that is
expected in plugins for options. In order for this to work, we needed
to make some minor changes.

Change-Id: I3801f339511155a4b8ecab91bb06b286b11c0a06
Related-Bug: #1758462
(cherry picked from commit 3631fd4791dd13977e446ee8445dbd1225d890bc)

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I7548e13bea9eb17e0fa5cfabc99e8aa0113f104b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 01:12:47.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

The ComputeManager.pre_live_migration method, which runs on the
destination host during live migration, calls setup_networks_on_host
with the destination host which causes the "migrating_to" attribute
to get set to the destination host in the port binding profile. This
is to initiate setting up floating IP information on the destination
host for DVR.

The ComputeManager.post_live_migration_at_destination method calls the
same method from the destination host, so at this point the "migrating_to"
attribute is already set to the destination host in the port binding
profile from pre_live_migration and we make unnecessary port update calls
to Neutron for each port attached to the instance.

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453
'}, {'created': '2018-03-30 21:38:14.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

is to initiate setting up floating IP information on the destination
host for DVR.

The ComputeManager.post_live_migration_at_destination method calls the
same method from the destination host, so at this point the "migrating_to"
attribute is already set to the destination host in the port binding

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453
'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 17:11:34.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

The ComputeManager.pre_live_migration method, which runs on the
destination host during live migration, calls setup_networks_on_host
with the destination host which causes the "migrating_to" attribute
to get set to the destination host in the port binding profile. This
is to initiate setting up floating IP information on the destination
host for DVR.

The ComputeManager.post_live_migration_at_destination method calls the
same method from the destination host, so at this point the "migrating_to"
attribute is already set to the destination host in the port binding
profile from pre_live_migration and we make unnecessary port update calls
to Neutron for each port attached to the instance.

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453

commit_message:
Converge distro interfaces to systemd-networkd

This change pulls all of our different distro interfaces into a unfied
set. To do this, we're using a common systemd-networkd role which gives
all distros the same network setup, capabilities, and configurations.

Change-Id: I770fc7296490ed09320f9a2e678758d971e2e29a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

If there are idps in a domain, when users try to delete the
domain, 500 interal error will raise.

Change-Id: Ica6230c488b04f016ae9c07f31ad788f3ba2610e
Partial-bug: #1760809
"}]
commit_message:
Expose a bug that the domain can't be deleted

If there are idps in a domain, when users try to delete the
domain, 500 interal error will raise.

Change-Id: Ica6230c488b04f016ae9c07f31ad788f3ba2610e
Partial-bug: #1760809

I actually think it's easier on reviewers when the test methods are not DRY'd up in this manner. When they are done like this, reviewers need to jump up into the DRY'd up method and then trace through conditionals introduced as parameters to the _test() method to determine what the changes to assertions are. This is more cumbersome, IMHO, than just having the test fixtures re-established (even if duplicated) in each individual unit test method.

But... I won't block on this. Just stating my opinion.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-30 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-03-31 00:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
DRY up test_rollback_live_migration_set_migration_status

This test was 99% redundant with test_rollback_live_migration()
except for the migration_status override, so it's refactored into
a common method.

Change-Id: Ia167cf1a08281932b9f4ae40aae6885e65cfc538

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 15:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781
'}]
commit_message:
Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781

commit_message:
Add support for per role FFU upgrade

This change adds the option to run the FFU workflow in batches per
roles. The newly introduced workflow first updates the controller
role and then the compute role. In addition it enables running FFU
for compute nodes in a rolling fashion.

Change-Id: I996df8f149ffefe71b20a82cbc979cdc5b3dda11
(cherry picked from commit 1f004eeb769ece48e39ace9ea002925eff7900f6)

commit_message:
Support both rabbitmq and oslo.messaging service nodes

This commit selects either the rabbitmq hosts or the
hosts associated to oslo.messaging rpc and notify services.
This is required for the transition of t-h-t to the use
of the separated oslo.messaging service backends.

This patch:
*select rpc and notify hosts from rabbitmq or oslo_messaging
*modify qdrouterd inter-router link port
*update qdr unit spec
*add release note

Needed-By: I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0
Change-Id: I154e2fe6f66b296b9b643627d57696e5178e1815

commit_message:
Clarify deprecation of "async" parameter

For vendor passthru decorators, the "async" parameter is deprecated.
This clarifies the messaging we emit (via logs and release notes), and
adds a TODO so we don't forget to delete the "async" parameter in
Stein cycle.

This is a follow up to Change-Id: I6299aafd30faae9a93df2cb901c1505df47e6b45.

Change-Id: I63ddf453584f4e7e8d2fa778ec50b8debcb86bf4
Task: 9289
Story: 1751306

commit_message:
undercloud: allow to configure ctlplane_masquerade in undercloud.conf

In some setups, we need to enable masquerading (it's the case in our CI
with OVB jobs), so we need to use the new interface from tripleoclient
so we can enable the feature and configure the masquerading rules.

Change-Id: I94f1783f5673941d2b72ef8077c84e547d7536df

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It causes fail in
requirements-check.

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: I1fbb434e03a39c0352048d9e5a5c49d172b3413d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 01:21:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use agent_gateway_port for address_scope matching

In connect_rtr_2_fip there is a check for self.fip_ns.agent_gateway_port
which is not used afterwards and ex_gw_port is used instead. The problem
with ex_gw_port is that it does not contain the necessary information,
including address scopes, if a tenant network has been added before an
external network to a router. This leads to a mismatch in address scopes
and results in order-dependent behavior - routes to tenant networks are
not added to fip namespaces although the documented conditions have
been fulfilled.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}, {'created': '2018-04-02 11:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use agent_gateway_port for address_scope matching

In connect_rtr_2_fip there is a check for self.fip_ns.agent_gateway_port
which is not used afterwards and ex_gw_port is used instead. The problem
with ex_gw_port is that it does not contain the necessary information,
including address scopes, if a tenant network has been added before an
external network to a router. This leads to a mismatch in address scopes
and results in order-dependent behavior - routes to tenant networks are
not added to fip namespaces although the documented conditions have
been fulfilled.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}, {'created': '2018-04-02 13:27:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use agent_gateway_port for address_scope matching

and results in order-dependent behavior - routes to tenant networks are
not added to fip namespaces although the documented conditions have
been fulfilled.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971

which is not used afterwards and ex_gw_port is used instead. The problem
with ex_gw_port is that it does not contain the necessary information,
including address scopes, if a tenant network has been added before an
external network to a router. This leads to a mismatch in address scopes
and results in order-dependent behavior - routes to tenant networks are
not added to fip namespaces although the documented conditions have
been fulfilled.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}, {'created': '2018-04-05 03:52:05.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}, {'created': '2018-04-05 15:10:03.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh router objects after port binding

there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971

commit_message:
SR-IOV agent should specify host when requesting devices info

Otherwise neutron server may set BUILD status for ports not bound
to agent's host.

Closes-Bug: #1702635
Change-Id: Ic0aa2b5d8fb5ad682293ce2b8e44606ef862a62d

subject: Fix intermittent failing probetest
messages:
[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this was the traceback:

    Apr  5 22:59:36 saio container-6011: UNCAUGHT EXCEPTION\x19Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/bin/swift-container-server", line 6, in <module>
        exec(compile(open(__file__).read(), __file__, 'exec'))
      File "/vagrant/swift/bin/swift-container-server", line 25, in <module>
        sys.exit(run_wsgi(conf_file, 'container-server', **options))
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/wsgi.py", line 979, in run_wsgi
        pid, status = green_os.wait()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/green/os.py", line 78, in wait
        return waitpid(0, 0)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/green/os.py", line 96, in waitpid
        greenthread.sleep(0.01)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 35, in sleep
        hub.switch()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 295, in switch
        return self.greenlet.switch()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 347, in run
        self.wait(sleep_time)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/poll.py", line 81, in wait
        time.sleep(seconds)
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/wsgi.py", line 940, in kill_children
        logger.error('SIGTERM received')
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1464, in error
        self.logger.error(msg, *args, **kwargs)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1193, in error
        self._log(ERROR, msg, args, **kwargs)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1286, in _log
        self.handle(record)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1296, in handle
        self.callHandlers(record)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1336, in callHandlers
        hdlr.handle(record)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 757, in handle
        self.acquire()
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 708, in acquire
        self.lock.acquire()
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 4993, in acquire
        trampoline(self.rfd, read=True)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/__init__.py", line 145, in trampoline
        assert hub.greenlet is not current, 'do not call blocking functions from the mainloop'
    AssertionError: do not call blocking functions from the mainloop

and as I understand the failure, making the test more stable could have been as easy as:'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

...

    diff --git a/swift/common/wsgi.py b/swift/common/wsgi.py
    index 752e876..e62445d 100644
    --- a/swift/common/wsgi.py
    +++ b/swift/common/wsgi.py
    @@ -937,10 +937,10 @@ def run_wsgi(conf_path, app_section, *args, **kwargs):
     
         def kill_children(*args):
             """Kills the entire process group."""
    -        logger.error('SIGTERM received')
             signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, signal.SIG_IGN)
             running[0] = False
             os.killpg(0, signal.SIGTERM)
    +        logger.error('SIGTERM received')
     
         def hup(*args):

(5 comments)

I've seen those sorts of errors too... seems like it doesn't always cause a failure OMM though?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)

So I've been testing

         def kill_children(*args):
             """Kills the entire process group."""
    -        logger.error('SIGTERM received')
             signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, signal.SIG_IGN)
             running[0] = False
             os.killpg(0, signal.SIGTERM)

... and it really *does* seem to fix the intermittent probe test failure - I wonder if I should just do that here and then go futz around with the signal handling stuff on master or try and trick Sam into doing it?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 01:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix intermittent failing probetest

When running probetests in a loop I discovered that the
container-servers were not always shutdown cleanly.  When handling the
SIGTERM received by a manager the parent process would occasionally
crash an assertion in the eventlet hub by doing blocking I/O in a signal
handler.  The child process would never receive the forwarded SIGTERM
and continue to accept requests on the listening socket.

By moving all I/O (logging and the associated PipeMutex locking) out of
the signal handler the child processes can reliably shutdown cleanly.

In my samples the test seems to be significantly more stable.

Change-Id: I5436063299f88106353cfa0ecd9a8b0b59c7af25
'}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent failing probetest

When running probetests in a loop I discovered that the
container-servers were not always shutdown cleanly.  When handling the
SIGTERM received by a manager the parent process would occasionally
crash an assertion in the eventlet hub by doing blocking I/O in a signal
handler.  The child process would never receive the forwarded SIGTERM
and continue to accept requests on the listening socket.

By moving all I/O (logging and the associated PipeMutex locking) out of
the signal handler the child processes can reliably shutdown cleanly.

In my samples the test seems to be significantly more stable.

Change-Id: I5436063299f88106353cfa0ecd9a8b0b59c7af25

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 15:31:47.000000000', 'message': 'Do the api_db sync before db sync

While upgrading from Queens to Rocky, if the db sync is done before
the api_db sync it will result in an InternalError because of a
schema change in the nova_api.cell_mappings table. So the nova_api
has to be synced before nova_cell db.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775
'}, {'created': '2018-04-06 16:03:54.000000000', 'message': 'Do the api_db sync before db sync

This patchset swaps the order of doing api_db sync with db_sync.
The API database migration should be run before the migrations for
the main/cell databases. This is because the former contains
information about how to find and connect to the latter.

This was discovered in Rocky since we added a data model change
(a new column to the cell_mappings table) that depends on db sync
being run after having added this new column to the api_db (i.e running
api_db sync before db sync). The data model change was the first time
where the actual sync order became meaningful.

This has been correctly done in devstack and the fact that grenade was
doing the db sync before api_db sync was hidden by the fact that
devstack had run at least once before reaching this part of grenade,
which meant that the database was already initialized.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775
'}, {'created': '2018-04-06 16:05:08.000000000', 'message': 'Do the api_db sync before db sync

being run after having added this new column to the api_db (i.e running
api_db sync before db sync). The data model change was the first time
where the actual sync order became meaningful.

This has been correctly done in devstack and the fact that grenade was
doing the db sync before api_db sync was hidden by the fact that
devstack had run at least once before reaching this part of grenade,
which meant that the database was already initialized.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775
'}]
commit_message:
Do the api_db sync before db sync

This patch swaps the order of doing api_db sync with db_sync.
The API database migration should be run before the migrations for
the main/cell databases. This is because the former contains
information about how to find and connect to the latter.

This was discovered in Rocky since we added a data model change
(a new column to the cell_mappings table) that depends on db sync
being run after having added this new column to the api_db (i.e running
api_db sync before db sync). The data model change was the first time
where the actual sync order became meaningful.

This has been correctly done in devstack and the fact that grenade was
doing the db sync before api_db sync was hidden by the fact that
devstack had run at least once before reaching this part of grenade,
which meant that the database was already initialized.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775

commit_message:
Ensure neutron-vpn-agent not used in Trusty Mitaka

The neutron-vpn-agent package was deprecated some time
ago and Xenial Mitaka install will use the
neutron-l3-agent package where as Trusty Mitaka will
erroneously install neutron-vpn-agent.

Change-Id: Ibfb53851683a685b252174504cbe2efaf43e6e9d
Closes-Bug: #1761514

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It causes fail in
requirements-check.

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: I5f26375a5e55da9449635dbfd0b0e8d0968f485e

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: I6d7a9af234b7a8a6e83f9a730ffe1c4fd698786a
(cherry picked from commit e7b21c813ca9c53b02f4629c669b041c77b87c3e)

subject: Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 14:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved

As feddora 26 nodes are in the process of being removed to be
replaced with fedora 27, this ps moves the fedora job to be
nonvoting until we can get any issues with fedora 27 resolved.

Change-Id: I5a494ded649ae3fa3be5ab133d1080d6fb6dd3d7
'}]
commit_message:
Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved

As feddora 26 nodes are in the process of being removed to be
replaced with fedora 27, this ps moves the fedora job to be
nonvoting until we can get any issues with fedora 27 resolved.

Change-Id: I5a494ded649ae3fa3be5ab133d1080d6fb6dd3d7

commit_message:
Upgrade webpack to 4

* Upgrade webpack to 4.0.1
* Upgrade webpack-dev-server to 3.1.0
* Introduce webpack-cli
* Introduce mode configuration
* Remove uglify plugin configuration

commit_message:
update cfgvalidator for oslo.config 6.0.1

New oslo.config version changed signature of a method
cfgvalidator relies on. Updated accordingly to work
for both new and old oslo.config.

Closes-Bug: 1761258

commit_message:
[cli] Use json.loads instead of yaml while importing results

Rally Task results are json file, there are no reasons to use yaml
deserializer for importing result. Even more, usage of yaml
deserializer affects the performance of import operation.

Change-Id: I965e0608ed8667e4a43de3323a63a948dab29bd6

commit_message:
DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260
(cherry picked from commit ed7dd4dae0cf80f2314d9e113995e63a362b8295)

commit_message:
DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260
(cherry picked from commit ed7dd4dae0cf80f2314d9e113995e63a362b8295)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.11

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

[{'created': '2018-03-16 17:41:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes mgmt net fact setting

commit_message:
Fixes mgmt net and flavor fact setting

This will fix the management network and flavor fact
setting which is not shared among multiple hosts
during install.

Closes-Bug: 1755929

Change-Id: I3b056b1ac7b7770926a79597744cbb48ef99fe63

commit_message:
Make download_config backwards compatible

For lp:1752118 we're changing the way ansible playbooks are
downloaded to no longer use tmpdirs.  This change adds support
for both output_dir styles to
DeployUndercloud._download_ansible_playbooks so that changes
I68a72e11dd66d8d5100512683633caa2174f9e6b and
Ie00f71b12f56262985c47810be0e80402e9e558e can pass the gate.

Change-Id: Ibb59b044dc0c14bf48dc3d500536195230414c81
Related-Bug: 1752118

commit_message:
Fix callback plugin for Ansible 2.5 compatability

Ansible 2.5 changed an internal callback method around that is
expected in plugins for options. In order for this to work, we needed
to make some minor changes.

Change-Id: I3801f339511155a4b8ecab91bb06b286b11c0a06
Related-Bug: #1758462

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I55af9e8cbfc0f7a0a99f142a11c4d335f00a4829

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 17:13:25.000000000', 'message': 'Handle migrating encryption key IDs in Backup table

Enhance the code that migrates the ConfKeyManager's fixed_key to
Barbican to also consider the Backup table. When the original key
migration feature was added, the encryption key ID was not stored in
the Backup table. But now the Backup table contains that field, so
the migration code needs to handle that table as well.

Whereas the cinder-volume service is responsible for migrating keys
in the Volume and Snapshot tables, the cinder-backup service handles
migrating keys in the Backup table. Each instance of the service
migrates its own entries by matching the "host" field in the
corresponding tables.

The Backup OVO now inherits from base.CinderComparableObject. This does
not affect the object's hash signature, and so the version number does
need to be incremented.

Closes-Bug: #1757235
Change-Id: Id4581eec80f82925c20c424847bff1baceda2349

Closes-Bug: #1757235

not affect the object's hash signature, and so the version number does
need to be incremented.

Closes-Bug: #1757235
Change-Id: Id4581eec80f82925c20c424847bff1baceda2349
'}]
commit_message:
Handle migrating encryption key IDs in Backup table

Enhance the code that migrates the ConfKeyManager's fixed_key to
Barbican to also consider the Backup table. When the original key
migration feature was added, the encryption key ID was not stored in
the Backup table. But now the Backup table contains that field, so
the migration code needs to handle that table as well.

Whereas the cinder-volume service is responsible for migrating keys
in the Volume and Snapshot tables, the cinder-backup service handles
migrating keys in the Backup table. Each instance of the service
migrates its own entries by matching the "host" field in the
corresponding tables.

The Backup OVO now inherits from base.CinderComparableObject. This does
not affect the object's hash signature, and so the version number does
need to be incremented.

Closes-Bug: #1757235
Change-Id: Id4581eec80f82925c20c424847bff1baceda2349

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 15:28:23.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify/correct the ordering of API and Cell database schema updates

Everyone seems to agree that the only sane ordering of these operations
is "api first, cell after." However, grenade and our own documentation
shows the api database as coming after the main one. I believe this
was added to grenade in a sort of append operation, and thus after the
main database. This was done back when usage of the API database was
still optional (for upgrades) and thus the ordering didn't matter much.
Since the process has been correct (api first) in devstack for a long
time, and since grenade runs after devstack, we haven't had any issues.
A recent change to add something to a core data structure column format
highlighted the out-of-order-ness of this.

I also believe the docs got the same append behavior when adding the
command to the list, and/or it may have been copied from grenade, which
is our in-code manifestation of the upgrade steps.

Change-Id: I19f263ed314a8b01bbb07337467392cc1c146b66
Related-Bug: #1761775
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify/correct the ordering of API and Cell database schema updates

Everyone seems to agree that the only sane ordering of these operations
is "api first, cell after." However, grenade and our own documentation
shows the api database as coming after the main one. I believe this
was added to grenade in a sort of append operation, and thus after the
main database. This was done back when usage of the API database was
still optional (for upgrades) and thus the ordering didn't matter much.
Since the process has been correct (api first) in devstack for a long
time, and since grenade runs after devstack, we haven't had any issues.
A recent change to add something to a core data structure column format
highlighted the out-of-order-ness of this.

I also believe the docs got the same append behavior when adding the
command to the list, and/or it may have been copied from grenade, which
is our in-code manifestation of the upgrade steps.

Change-Id: I19f263ed314a8b01bbb07337467392cc1c146b66
Related-Bug: #1761775

It used to be the case that we would only do the local CA setup if we
would require a certificate for HAProxy. This is no longer the case as
we're trying to do TLS by default in the overcloud. So this instead

commit_message:
Include local CA installation outside of HAProxy cert setup

It used to be the case that we would only do the local CA setup if we
would require a certificate for HAProxy. This is no longer the case as
we're trying to do TLS by default in the overcloud. So this instead
moves that setup to the certmonger_user class which should always get
used.

Change-Id: I5b4dc0a60ccc988b1ffbbb04231e6688377dd0eb

commit_message:
Replace GB with GiB

In documents and comments, 'GB' (gigabyte) is used.
Strictly 'GiB' (gibibyte) should be used.
So replace 'GB' with 'GiB'.

Change-Id: Ic03f202d4fe357bc6400275abdccd4b37521f4a3
Closes-Bug: #1521791

'}, {'created': '2018-04-03 23:59:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError in getting a resource ID

In the 'wait_for_resource_delete' method of the 'ClientTestBase' class,
the following statement is executed when timeout.

  self.fail("The resource '%s' still exists." % resource.id)

The 'resource' variable is passed in the argument of
the 'wait_for_resource_delete' method.
It is sometimes a string which is a resource ID.

When it is a string (a resource ID), AttributeError is raised
at the statement.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I558026de54a5cc75359225b50054934a220f3e5c
Closes-Bug: #1704132
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in getting a resource ID

In the 'wait_for_resource_delete' method of the 'ClientTestBase' class,
the following statement is executed when timeout.

  self.fail("The resource '%s' still exists." % resource.id)

The 'resource' variable is passed in the argument of
the 'wait_for_resource_delete' method.
It is sometimes a string which is a resource ID.

When it is a string (a resource ID), AttributeError is raised
at the statement.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I558026de54a5cc75359225b50054934a220f3e5c
Closes-Bug: #1704132

In the "Update Aggregate" API,
if both an availability zone and a name are not specified,
a 400 error is returned.

It should be checked in the novaclient side (nova command).
So add the validation for it at the 'nova aggregate-update' command.

Closes-Bug: #1696891

commit_message:
Fix validation for command arguments

In the "Update Aggregate" API,
if both an availability zone and a name are not specified,
a 400 error is returned.

It should be checked in the novaclient side (nova command).
So add the validation for it at the 'nova aggregate-update' command.

Change-Id: If50579ef3572a10b67e6da32e3258917901e9d9d
Closes-Bug: #1696891

Which it is."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-19 23:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-02-20 04:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-03-12 11:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Not sure about this being a free for all, but I am probably missing something.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-12 13:56:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

I think the mechanism described here is good. The remaining issues seem to be around how we're going to handle traits coming from multiple sources of (potential) authority which I don't think we can resolve here nor will they change this mechanism (at least not much) so: groovy."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-03-12 15:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Not sure about this being a free for all, but I am probably missing
 > something.

> either configuration or flavors that allow a whitelist of optional traits an image could request

Having a configuration for a whitelist of traits should apply to flavor traits also for consistency. I think its end of the days its more of a usability change(validating traits etc) and its out of scope for this spec IMO.

whitelist of image traits from flavor does not seem workable because flavor and image are independent and can be chosen in any order.

For #2,

the concern seems to be user can add traits on glance image which can request "chargeable" traits without the need to go through flavor and potentially avoid billing. is that right?

@jaypipes mentioned this is probably an existing problem wrt to glance image NUMA properties.

i did not know about protected properties in glance, thanks for pointing it out :).

I think protected properties can solve the issue you brought up though. The operator can make all/subset of traits on images as protected properties if he wants them to be chargeable.

For example, a policy defined like below would make user not be able to add any chargeable traits to the image property

[^trait.*_chargeable_.*]
create = admin,
read = admin, user
update = admin
delete = admin,user

The operator can cede control of certain properties to the user as needed and retain control over chargeable properties  by making the use of flavor mandatory for chargeable traits.

The policy can be as granular as possbile to prevent cases of billing issues.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-03-13 02:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-03-13 05:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-13 18:23:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Questions inline, plus there is a work item to change a filter that doesn't actually exist, so I'm not sure what that meant."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-03-14 17:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-14 17:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-03-14 19:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-03-14 19:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-14 21:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2
