revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 21:48:04.000000000', 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
"}, {'created': '2018-03-31 23:19:05.000000000', 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956

commit_message:
Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956

[{'created': '2018-04-04 18:57:58.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-grafyaml zuul jobs

Create system-required job for the project, we'll also including a
project .zuul.yaml file once ready to bring those jobs online.

Change-Id: Ia07b0be90496747fcfc19fe3dd94bb72be0e27fa

commit_message:
Escalate privileges when copy fluentd custom config

Fluentd custom output and filter configs target directory can have unknown
permissions, so copy these configs as root.

Change-Id: I1649f8cd4a5066245e8f79e8e71b6bbf04dbcb62
Closes-Bug: #1760213

When specifying the layout for the hardened image, we need
also to specify the device type, that in our case will be

Change-Id: Ic0ad151cc12723e437a1123f90c6663198b9564d

commit_message:
Add a dependency on block-device-mbr element

When specifying the layout for the hardened image, we need
also to specify the device type, that in our case will be
mbr. So add this as a dependency of overcloud-secure to
properly set the type.

Change-Id: Ic0ad151cc12723e437a1123f90c6663198b9564d
(cherry picked from commit 950a63f77c8c9da9ce6c7fccb80fabd980a4e4bc)

commit_message:
Use method validate_integer from oslo.utils

We added method validate_integer in oslo.utils 3.33.0 [1],
so we can simply use that validate_integer method in Masakari.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508401/

Change-Id: Id773d107cf06ade64adbb5af5c764f4adeb914d7

commit_message:
Add git timeout setting for nodepool-builder

Use GIT_HTTP_LOW_SPEED_* as a way to time out the git operations
talking to remote servers. This should help prevent git from hanging
when we clone remote repos from git.o.o.

Change-Id: I0e8f8a2bbdf43d5e49c92ed744ba224c2eeccdf8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 15:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove fedora-26 nodes from nodepool

We've had fedora-27 nodes online for a while now, plus we've recommend
jobs be moved to fedora-27:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/127945.html

We really only want to keep a single fedora node online, due to how
long the support lifecyle is.

Change-Id: Ie13e68eb3e7a266aa51d883b6d410832565e8f16
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove fedora-26 nodes from nodepool

We've had fedora-27 nodes online for a while now, plus we've recommend
jobs be moved to fedora-27:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/127945.html

We really only want to keep a single fedora node online, due to how
long the support lifecyle is.

Change-Id: Ie13e68eb3e7a266aa51d883b6d410832565e8f16
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
NEC driver: Disallow access from the source node after live-migration.

NEC driver deletes access permission from nodes in the method
remove_export().
However, the method remove_export() is not called after live-migration.
After live-migration, access permission of the live-migration source
node is not deleted.

This patch adds the step to delete access permission from the node
in the method terminate_connection().
The terminate_connection() is called after live-migration and
access permission of the source node is deleted.

Change-Id: Id605eb6ff61cd1d382bf82173e6d65b986dda398
Closes-Bug: #1753375

commit_message:
Switch qinling-tempest to a voting check and gate job

It is important to guarantee that a change won't break any existing
tempest checks before the change can be merged.

Change-Id: I9295d6cb1097d48a17c890eea2afc5850182fc54

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' section as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ia8e8d6b4e23c2737a9e948e7c4b682dca697f6a4

commit_message:
Remove sphinx settings from setup.cfg

These don't appear to hurt anything, but they are no longer used
and should be removed to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I849d5bcc7c59803342b4399d5199e280d1842d06

These are my observations:

1) The general direction looks good but test failures need to be addressed

2) Callbacks are very fundamental to Neutron and this patch introduces significant changes to it. I don't want to rush this kind of change through the 1 day that we have left for RC1. So I am going to take bug 1745633 out of the RC and let's work on this to merge in Rocky

3) It probably also deserves some consideration by the drivers team, so I will bring it up at the first chance I have in the drivers meeting"}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-07 20:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-07 20:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-07 20:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

- If we decide to move FW with this we'd need a release note as well.
- Ideally this would also update the callback internal docs [1] to describe the priority handling.
- I also wonder if the UT coverage is sufficient? I was hoping to see a bit more in terms of priority subscribe/call/unsubscribe, but perhaps I'm being overly cautious.
- Are there other options to priorities? For example what if when subscribing you could "depend" on other resources/events to express the priority? Just food for thought.
- We are moving to event callback payloads rather than kwargs for callbacks. If we decide to go with this priority system does it make sense to include the priority in the event payload, or is this information never going to be useful to callbacks?


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-02-21 01:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Once it's agreed that the direction is good, testcases and other tech gaps will be addressed.

So far the considered ways are
- callback cascading: it turned out that it doesn't work well. more resources/callbacks would be needed. so other way has been sought.
- utilizing sqlalchemy event to ensure that callbacks of l3 flavor dirver are called last. the feedback is that it's too ugly/complex
- callback priority: this patch.
- explicity dependency to callbacks(your(boden) proposal)"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-03-01 09:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
callback: priority to specify calling order

Add priority to specify calling order.
l3 flavor requires to enforce calling order which is discussed at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523257/

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ib4fa951eabc184c9d175e32b1db4af68a836dc10
Partial-bug: #1745633

commit_message:
Add --enable and --disable options to  nova-manage update_cell

Through these new options, users can enable or disable a cell
through the CLI.

Related to blueprint cell-disable

Change-Id: I761f2e2b1f1cc2c605f7da504a8c8647d6d6a45e

[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa

commit_message:
Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa
(cherry picked from commit b95eafb0eeaaa8700b1293aec9a68b252602af00)

commit_message:
Remove role_data from inventory

role_data is extremely verbose and not actually needed since
Idfdce6f0a778b0a7f2fed17ff56d1a3e451868ab landed. Removing it from the
inventory will improve readability.

Removing it also avoids issues with hostvars since the role_data_* keys
are set as host variables and are not properly escaped when the task
lists include jinja themselves.

Change-Id: I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f

commit_message:
masquerade: stop using YAQL for iptables data

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1760211 but the YAQL + Heat
format hasn't helped us to build the data needed by Puppet to create
IPtables rules for masquerading.

We'll solve it in puppet-tripleo with native hash iterations, so for
that we just export MasqueradeNetworks to Hiera and we'll use this data
from the puppet module directly.

Depends-On: I8dda3c164de90954855979529de4f1100a858b45

Related-Bug: #1760211
Change-Id: I81379cf93f505fb65c1ad7e6a2adcc6942b04bc0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 20:46:20.000000000', 'message': "undercloud: increase token expiration time

We did it in the past (3 years ago!) in instack-undercloud:
https://github.com/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/43e792c6844d4a7081b718d7f89b0c40f5cfb708
in the context of: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1235908

This time, we have the same problem when the undercloud is
containeirized.
This patch is actually setting parity with keystone config from
instack-undercloud, but also raising an actual issue that will be
addressed this cycle.

In the meantime, let's increase the token expiration so we can move
forward with testing the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: Iceaaf53fae44b5bcda9f6517f163939ba6be3d49
Related-Bug: #1761050
"}]
commit_message:
undercloud: increase token expiration time

We did it in the past (3 years ago!) in instack-undercloud:
https://github.com/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/43e792c6844d4a7081b718d7f89b0c40f5cfb708
in the context of: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1235908

This time, we have the same problem when the undercloud is
containeirized.
This patch is actually setting parity with keystone config from
instack-undercloud, but also raising an actual issue that will be
addressed this cycle.

In the meantime, let's increase the token expiration so we can move
forward with testing the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: Iceaaf53fae44b5bcda9f6517f163939ba6be3d49
Related-Bug: #1761050

commit_message:
Make generation optional in ProviderTree

Since ProviderTree methods are expected to be used in
ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree [1], wherein the generation should
not be specified (it will be ignored by
SchedulerReportClient.update_from_provider_tree [2] anyway), this change
makes the generation argument optional for ProviderTree methods new_root
and update_inventory.  (It was already optional for all the other
methods.)

TODOs are added to deal with generation properly from some places in the
report client - see the related bug.

commit_message:
Add firewall rule to octavia health mgmt iface

The Octavia amphora agent periodically sends heartbeat packets to the
Octavia health manager service which listens on udp/5555. A firewall
rule needs to be added to allow such traffic on interface
OctaviaMgmtPortDevName.

Change-Id: If6c98c18dfe02d5ab8af1806fed401ab945ed18a

commit_message:
Add __repr__ for NovaException

Due to change c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8 in
oslo.serialization, serialized exceptions in errors no longer
have kwargs. This change fixes the problem by adding __repr__
to NovaException which will return a string representation
of exception.__dict__. This string contains the exception message
along with all the kwargs. Without __repr__, the serialization
process for exceptions just returns the exception type and the
default message, without the kwargs.

Change-Id: I653282a030d03362dfca0fd1026cebe920d54e37
Closes-Bug: #1756360

commit_message:
Allow providing --ssh-user for update/upgrade run commands

When config-download becomes our only way of deploying, we'll be able
to assume that tripleo-admin user always exists. Until then it's not a
given, so we need to allow using custom user names for running updates
and upgrades playbooks. We default to heat-admin for now, as that's
expected to work on majority of current production environments.

Change-Id: I0df57002b2305c1e2504c9f7a7d0c326d8ffcaf7
Closes-Bug: #1759845

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 22:36:40.000000000', 'message': "Broaden our per-broker exception handling

This way, if we hit an uncaught exception in
_identify_sharding_candidate we won't bomb out of the entire sharding
cycle. Bonus: we'll get more context about which db file caused the
exception.

FWIW, the exception that led to this change was

   OperationalError: no such table: container_stat

coming up from get_shard_ranges as we try to get our own shard range.
Not sure what that's about yet.

Note that we can now have more failures than attempts in the recon
stats.

Change-Id: I717c85c329b72ac880a2f6232852d7821f50a8f2
"}]
commit_message:
Broaden our per-broker exception handling

This way, if we hit an uncaught exception in
_identify_sharding_candidate we won't bomb out of the entire sharding
cycle. Bonus: we'll get more context about which db file caused the
exception.

FWIW, the exception that led to this change was

   OperationalError: no such table: container_stat

coming up from get_shard_ranges as we try to get our own shard range.
Not sure what that's about yet.

Note that we can now have more failures than attempts in the recon
stats.

Change-Id: I717c85c329b72ac880a2f6232852d7821f50a8f2

commit_message:
Rename pull_catalog args from version to branch

It was a very bad idea to name the argument to fetch a specific
version from Zanata as 'version'.

At the moment I get this error mesage:
argparse.ArgumentError: argument --version: conflicting option string(s): --version

Change-Id: I662a218a2713fcefd3a624a4cc2a907a7fc1434b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 15:26:33.000000000', 'message': "Fail enroll workflow early on invalid power credentials

Currently if the power credentials are invalid, the node goes back to
the 'enroll' state, but we keep waiting until timeout. This patch
fixes it.

Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5
Closes-Bug: #1667776
"}, {'created': '2018-03-14 13:23:00.000000000', 'message': 'Rework set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows do not use mistral "retry" correctly.
The "retry" actions are only run if the action fails, but ironic.get_node
does not fail in our case (unless it's broken for any other reason).

This change adds helper workflows that fail if the current state does
not match the expected one. This way the retries work correctly.
It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout.

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5
'}, {'created': '2018-03-14 14:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Rework set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows do not use mistral "retry" correctly.
The "retry" actions are only run if the action fails, but ironic.get_node
does not fail in our case (unless it's broken for any other reason).

This change adds helper workflows that fail if the current state does
not match the expected one. This way the retries work correctly.
It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout.

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5
'}, {'created': '2018-03-14 16:26:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix error handling in set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows succeed in any case, since we don't have
any condition to fail. This change makes them fail if the resulting
state does not match the expected one.

It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout. Proper error message
is returned to avoid confusing operators.

Finally, it reduces the traffic between mistral and ironic by only
requesting the required fields.

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5

commit_message:
Fix error handling in set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows succeed in any case, since we don't have
any condition to fail. This change makes them fail if the resulting
state does not match the expected one.

It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout. Proper error message
is returned to avoid confusing operators.

Finally, it reduces the traffic between mistral and ironic by only
requesting the required fields.

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5

commit_message:
undercloud: load masquerade-networks service

If masquerade is enabled (set to True), we want to deploy the
masquerade-networks service on the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I8c35cde0e2d41588d88397ddef0bf5a6776b9aa4

commit_message:
Add a dependency on block-device-mbr element

When specifying the layout for the hardened image, we need
also to specify the device type, that in our case will be
mbr. So add this as a dependency of overcloud-secure to
properly set the type.

Change-Id: Ic0ad151cc12723e437a1123f90c6663198b9564d

The recently merged change Ie8543bed3363aac539cfd35e04e8dfaaa166ebc3
added five new options to undercloud.conf to drive the container
prepare during undercloud install. However this is not nearly as
flexible as the prepare workflow for overcloud deploy, which can have
multiple entries in the ContainerImagePrepare parameter list.

This change removes those new options, and uses the specified
container_images_file file as the source for the ContainerImagePrepare
parameter *or* the container image parameters.

If no file is specified, the environment has a default

commit_message:
Use container_images_file for all image prepare

The recently merged change Ie8543bed3363aac539cfd35e04e8dfaaa166ebc3
added five new options to undercloud.conf to drive the container
prepare during undercloud install. However this is not nearly as
flexible as the prepare workflow for overcloud deploy, which can have
multiple entries in the ContainerImagePrepare parameter list.

This change removes those new options, and uses the specified
container_images_file file as the source for the ContainerImagePrepare
parameter *or* the container image parameters.

If no file is specified, the environment has a default
ContainerImagePrepare parameter set which will result in a working
undercloud based on the defaults in kolla_builder.

Change-Id: Ic1e6eb5ff0aaeaded279c97139adc9fdebb12857
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

[{'created': '2018-03-30 19:24:51.000000000', 'message': "Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33

commit_message:
Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/557720
- https://review.openstack.org/558524

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33

Best guess here...

* When we run `tox -evenv-tempest -- tempest run` then we don't have the heat_integrationtests tempest plugin installed in that tox environment, so it doesn't find anything to run. e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/82/550682/4/check/grenade-heat/5e87169/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-03-08_11_09_23_071 
* When we run `tempest run --regex` we get a *different* version of tempest that uses testr instead of stestr, but only during the grenade run, so it fails to find a config file. e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/82/550682/7/check/grenade-heat/e36d71c/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-03-09_06_03_53_251"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Update .stestr.conf with the group_regex

Tempest has switched to stestr. Update the group_regex in
.stestr.conf

Note: In branches older than stable/queens this has broken
the integration tests.

Change-Id: I6f12f95367748828977550ede5043d2f6b7e9970
Closes-Bug: #1750960

[{'created': '2017-11-09 16:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Take context from environment instead of parsing headers

oslo.context can already parse the environment which should have been

commit_message:
Take context from environment instead of parsing headers

oslo.context can already parse the environment which should have been
filled by the wsgi engine. So lets use that instead.

Change-Id: Ie4b6e377f1b43c985ec47a47571e026e5285f92e

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port.  This patch
updates the glance install guide to reflect that change.

Backporting because this issue is collecting a lot of duplicate bug filings.

Closes-bug: #1754104

Change-Id: I6134097f4ec78bf34a03f3ce6d8564bd324eb1b3
(cherry picked from commit 7dfce420279423708138596c6646551308058b50)

[{'created': '2018-04-03 19:47:23.000000000', 'message': "Insert WaitForPortDetach in delete amphora flow

In the failover flow we alreday wait for the port detach but
this isn't happening in the delete flow causing lb deletes to
fail because some ports are still hanging on (see also [1]).
This adds this wait to ensure that all plugged network ports
are properlydetached by nova.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549263/

Change-Id: Iff520659cd4bccdffaa27b1dde6f8e7090ae5740
"}]
commit_message:
Insert WaitForPortDetach in delete amphora flow

In the failover flow we alreday wait for the port detach but
this isn't happening in the delete flow causing lb deletes to
fail because some ports are still hanging on (see also [1]).
This adds this wait to ensure that all plugged network ports
are properlydetached by nova.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549263/

Change-Id: Iff520659cd4bccdffaa27b1dde6f8e7090ae5740

[{'created': '2018-04-04 23:08:33.000000000', 'message': "Add bandit ID to prefix of more_info link

In a recent commit [1], the names of the plugin doc files changed
to include the bandit ID as a prefix. Unfortunately, the doc_utils
wasn't updated at the time, so it still pointed to the previous
docs, thus resulting in 404 errors when browsing to the link.

This patch modifies doc_utils to properly prefix the bandit ID to
reference the doc for a particular plugin.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540170/

Change-Id: Ia4b4c87e880ba39a677a84fc53943bc7a37849ef
Closes-Bug: #1761254
"}]
commit_message:
Add bandit ID to prefix of more_info link

In a recent commit [1], the names of the plugin doc files changed
to include the bandit ID as a prefix. Unfortunately, the doc_utils
wasn't updated at the time, so it still pointed to the previous
docs, thus resulting in 404 errors when browsing to the link.

This patch modifies doc_utils to properly prefix the bandit ID to
reference the doc for a particular plugin.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540170/

Change-Id: Ia4b4c87e880ba39a677a84fc53943bc7a37849ef
Closes-Bug: #1761254

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-30 19:23:45.000000000', 'message': "Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33
(cherry picked from commit 8d10757619e4e243f0e65d85cf0730c48047562b)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-03 17:51:45.000000000', 'message': "Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/557720
- https://review.openstack.org/558524

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33
"}]
commit_message:
Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/557720
- https://review.openstack.org/558524

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33

subject: Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to get-pip-constraints'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 18:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-05 09:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I'm ok with that and see it as positive improvement backported -- however it doesn't seem to use global-requirement-pins.txt in the bootstrap ansible, which (was we've experienced the last days) can cause issues. Shouldn't we backport it at the same time? Do you want to do another patch next to that?"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-05 09:04:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@JP get_pip does already: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/stable/pike/scripts/scripts-library.sh#L314-L321

And the only applicable constraint for virtualenv is in upper constraints. If you'd like to apply the global pins constraint there too then that's a new patch to master which will need porting back."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-05 09:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Upgrading vote, concerns are solved.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-05 11:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck odd cache prep failure, but no evidence of what failed'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-05 15:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 12:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa
(cherry picked from commit b95eafb0eeaaa8700b1293aec9a68b252602af00)
'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 18:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa

commit_message:
Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa
(cherry picked from commit b95eafb0eeaaa8700b1293aec9a68b252602af00)

commit_message:
Use a pythonic delete.

Oh, those dim and misty times... Dinosaurs roamed the earth, and
we'd exec() rm instead of just using shutils to delete things.
Truly those were a simpler, more complicated to debug, and slower
to execute times.

I miss them.

Change-Id: Ib2bf0988d40168fd5519339f671f2c2e9692b1f6
blueprint: execs-ive-had-a-few

[{'created': '2018-04-05 13:08:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix web-download fails with default node_staging_uri

Web-download import method fails to import image to backend if
'node_staging_uri' is not set in glance-api.conf (or when the value
ends with a '/', as the default setting does) due to "local variable
'separator' referenced before assignment" error.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I056fb7a1f7a7ef6bc14ea54133cf083b2b9d9920
Closes-Bug: #1753964
(cherry picked from commit ff1ba4f3f5afcbd06a7bbb4cf4363ac8f368ee4c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix web-download fails with default node_staging_uri

Web-download import method fails to import image to backend if
'node_staging_uri' is not set in glance-api.conf (or when the value
ends with a '/', as the default setting does) due to "local variable
'separator' referenced before assignment" error.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I056fb7a1f7a7ef6bc14ea54133cf083b2b9d9920
Closes-Bug: #1753964
(cherry picked from commit ff1ba4f3f5afcbd06a7bbb4cf4363ac8f368ee4c)

commit_message:
Assume node traits in instance trait validation

In Rocky, we can assume that node.traits is set, since the earliest
version we may be pinned to is Queens, which supports node traits.

Change-Id: Ib011122a72f31e73e7e2031cb7582057e1f33ef4
Related-Bug: #1755146
Related-Bug: #1722194

Should we go ahead with this now? Does need to be added to upper-constraints.txt too though.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-04-05 09:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-04-05 09:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > upper-constraints.txt too though.

I think so. Just released 0.2.0 so we can publish this now.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-05 13:49:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've verified 0.2.0 is available on pypi. If this try fails again, we may need to check with infra to see if there is a local mirror sync issue."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-05 14:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

There are some commit message Q & A we usually want that are detailed here:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/README.rst#n265

But since this was discussed on the ML and has a few of us involved, I'm OK with this as is. Might want to add that if you need to update for some reason. Or if someone else from the requirements team feels more strongly about that.

But looks good to me, and I would like to see this get added so we can move forward with cleaning up some of the doc jobs that are relying on module API documentation."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-04-05 15:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Only states support for py27 and py35, which is the bare minimum (3.6 would be nice).  Otherwise looks good.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-05 16:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}]

commit_message:
Add sphinxcontrib-apidoc

This packages up most of the functionality of the autodoc feature
currently found in pbr as a Sphinx extension and is necessary so we can
migrate everyone away from the 'setup.py build_sphinx' way of building
documentation.

Change-Id: If27c35e573b22f99ebe54b935bc583a91c3cd0d2

commit_message:
Add nova-status check for ironic flavor migration

In Pike we started requiring that ironic instances have their
embedded flavor migrated to track the ironic node custom
resource class. This can be done either via the normal running
of the nova-compute service and ironic driver or via the
'nova-manage db ironic_flavor_migration' command.

This change adds a nova-status check to see if there are any
unmigrated ironic instances across all non-cell0 cells, and
is based mostly on the same logic within the nova-manage command
except it's multi-cell aware and doesn't use the objects.

Change-Id: Ifd22325e849db2353b1b1eedfe998e3d6a79591c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 22:07:37.000000000', 'message': "Switch rally job from q-* to neutron-* service names

When at least one service named as q-* is present in ENABLED_SERVICES,
then devstack utilizes lib/neutron-legacy to configure services
regardless of how other services are deployed (e.g. with lib/neutron).
This breaks deployment using lib/neutron.

Switching to new names doesn't change anything substantial because
devstack plugin equally handles both variants. It allows to use new
devstack neutron library though.

Change-Id: Id0d35523651131766a70e78bf130205c1c63acd5
(cherry picked from commit 661247a61708d9ceb716e0778ec0c83345ddd3ba)
"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 18:45:23.000000000', 'message': "Switch rally job from q-* to neutron-* service names

When at least one service named as q-* is present in ENABLED_SERVICES,
then devstack utilizes lib/neutron-legacy to configure services
regardless of how other services are deployed (e.g. with lib/neutron).
This breaks deployment using lib/neutron.

Switching to new names doesn't change anything substantial because
devstack plugin equally handles both variants. It allows to use new
devstack neutron library though.

Change-Id: Id0d35523651131766a70e78bf130205c1c63acd5
(cherry picked from commit 661247a61708d9ceb716e0778ec0c83345ddd3ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch rally job from q-* to neutron-* service names

When at least one service named as q-* is present in ENABLED_SERVICES,
then devstack utilizes lib/neutron-legacy to configure services
regardless of how other services are deployed (e.g. with lib/neutron).
This breaks deployment using lib/neutron.

Switching to new names doesn't change anything substantial because
devstack plugin equally handles both variants. It allows to use new
devstack neutron library though.

Change-Id: Id0d35523651131766a70e78bf130205c1c63acd5
(cherry picked from commit 661247a61708d9ceb716e0778ec0c83345ddd3ba)

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for neutron-sriov-agent

This patch adds script for docker health check of neutron-sriov-agent service.
The script checks existance of service with opened connections to RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: Ief543580e6b717bb9dba62b19ffe12aff5395ff9

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port.  This patch
updates the glance install guide to reflect that change.

Closes-bug: #1754104

Change-Id: I6134097f4ec78bf34a03f3ce6d8564bd324eb1b3

[{'created': '2018-04-05 13:27:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add known issue release note for PBR build failures

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. Given that the newton
roles are now EOL our only means to communicate to deployers how
they may resolve this failure is to implement a release note.

Change-Id: Ibdd4cca880b9f29764bde1a5d63133e2246510d7
'}]
commit_message:
Add known issue release note for PBR build failures

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. Given that the newton
roles are now EOL our only means to communicate to deployers how
they may resolve this failure is to implement a release note.

Change-Id: Ibdd4cca880b9f29764bde1a5d63133e2246510d7

commit_message:
Removing deprecated function 'IPWrapper.get_namespaces()'

'IPWrapper.get_namespaces()' is deprecated in version 'Queens'
and was marked to be removed 'Rocky'.
This patch removes it and switches to use
'neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib.list_network_namespaces' instead.

Change-Id: I090cc5841aca5b638d08d65645162811950d6437
Depends-On: Id629481fd722004a7b7d827bf6209785f85f4c64

commit_message:
Create ansible-role-grafyaml repository

Create an ansible role to be used by windmill for the purpose of
managing grafyaml. We won't be publishing to pypi or using official
documentation.

Change-Id: Ieb667044bc73394cd5d584b01d1e1db0b33c694f

commit_message:
Update sample local.conf from q-* to neutron-*

This commit updates our sample DevStack local.conf files with references
to neutron-* services instead of q-* services to make them match what we
have in the gates.

Change-Id: I681f5ae15a69d30561357ede3afe7fd2533d29cf

commit_message:
Add Kuryr pods logs to gate results

When Kuryr is run in pods, logs of its services are not available in the
gate. This commit adds dummy DevStack services that are running
`kubectl logs -f <container-name>` and will cause the logs to be
available in the gate results.

Partial-Implements: enhance-upstream-gates
Change-Id: I56d7c72200785587089d7f1c98c7a84a9885299f

commit_message:
Add support for Ironic Networking Baremetal

Add manifests to for Ironic Networking Baremetal componentes:
 - ML2 plug-in - baremetal mechanism driver
 - L2 Agent - ironic-neutron-agent

Change-Id: I3c40f84052a41ed440758b971975c5c81ace4225

commit_message:
Implement tripleo::masquerade_networks

It'll be used in the OS::TripleO::Services::MasqueradeNetworks service
to configure masquerade IPtables rules when needed for PoC or CI
environments.

Change-Id: I8dda3c164de90954855979529de4f1100a858b45
Related-Bug: #1760211

So if we want this for CI jobs as well, we'll need one more change, like making quickstart.sh to produce _quickstart_nice.log additionally to _quickstart.log and collect both in the CI logs collection steps"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-30 08:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-30 08:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to nice'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-03-30 18:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-01 17:37:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

It really prints much more nice output when I run it, but it's buffered very slow and I need to wait 10 seconds until bunch of messages will appear. From user experience it's awful, can you fix it in any way?"}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Sagi, indeed, that's quite annoying. I'll try the perl hack, or a finalization trap instead of the 3rd pipe into a tee.
Thank you for the hint Sergii! Testing it locally."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I didn't notice something improved with perl vs sed.
Prolly not a thing to be bothered for the deployment logs data amount for the subject. The issue with freezing outputs is in a piped tee at the end."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-04-04 16:54:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm all for generating better (additional) output files, but I have to agree with Sagi here that we should leave the console log as it exists unless we're quite sure that other tools that use it (e.g. sova) continue to work, as they are critical to tripleo-ci's ability to monitor CI jobs and such.

I also think that ansible output callback plugins are a more sustainable / better mechanism to modify ansible's output, vs. complex sed or perl passes on the ouput. Perhaps  we could use these.  There are existing ones [2], [3] as well that we could use now as well.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.5/plugins/callback.html#managing-stdout
[2] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.5/plugins/callback/dense.html
[3] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/khaleesi/blob/master/plugins/callbacks/human_log.py"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-05 15:18:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thank you for feedback folks! I'll come back to this once I have some spare time."}]

commit_message:
Produce nicer stdout for quickstart.sh

Produce *nicer* stdout for better visualisation of state/errors,
like those details hidden in huge JSON dicts and virt-customize
results.

Omit empty strings/lists/dicts in task exec results, like:
"stdout": "", "ansible_facts": {}, "ansible_included_var_files": []
This shortens the deploy log w/o useful info and improves readability.

Capture ansible's task execution results stored in the status tags like
"message", "cmd", "get_xml", "std*", "rc", line-wrapped nicely.

Important task exec tags like "end", "start", "rc", "delta" et al
are aligned by new lines, which gives a consistent view repeated
through all the tasks executed.

Store those to stdout and _quickstart_nice.log.
Store raw ansible logs as is in _quickstart.log (as is).

Change-Id: Iac7aae18f020adc8df0deb148f06af9e98aefba7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove adjust-interface-mtus script

- dhcp-match is already managed in Neutron since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/172040/
- MTU option shouldn't be managed by TripleO Quickstart.

Change-Id: I68701b45801c9c25f2a60d1a4afc51955a84c546

commit_message:
Cleanup project home page and add links

This change cleans up the project home page documentation and
adds links to both the template documents and the barbican
documentation. Future review findings should be added to the list.

Change-Id: I26691a1d800ba9c814cad78904aeb302be9d4cc2

commit_message:
Security findings for keystonemiddleware

This change adds keystonemiddleware architecture documentation as well
as initial findings of possible security vulnerabilities.

Change-Id: I2e7a96f46879586a372b71ebcaa8bfdd8faf7e39
Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>

commit_message:
Move create_image and upload_image_data

This refactoring is for making the code structure more consistent.
In particular, the image driver will be decoupled from compute
manager and align with volume/network driver.
In the new structure, compute manager is mainly for interfacing
with docker driver and docker driver is for interfacing with
image/volume/network drivers.

Change-Id: Ib270062e3a274d2c5d98c05375520ac46b644984

commit_message:
Add Kuryr pods logs to gate results

When Kuryr is run in pods, logs of its services are not available in the
gate. This commit adds a post-run playbook that will copy information
about Kubernetes resources and logs of all pods into the results.

Change-Id: Idac654854f0b968fe0c3024fd4f0436279a945a5
Partial-Implements: enhance-upstream-gates

[{'created': '2017-11-22 17:46:53.000000000', 'message': "ut updates for extending sub-resources

When extending an existing sub-resource definition, the
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP must define the extended resources/attributes
under the 'parameters' object. This instructs the API internals to
update the existing sub-resource's attribute map rather than just
overwrite it. For internals see the logic in the extend_resources()
method in neutron.api.extensions [1].

This patch adds that support to the base api def test case and also
updates the contributor internals to document such. No release note
included since nothing changed from a consumption perspective.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/api/extensions.py#L350

Change-Id: Ib91004490dc3ca71b7caafe5cc3cb07417be1e4c

commit_message:
ut updates for extending sub-resources

When extending an existing sub-resource definition, the
SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP must define the extended resources/attributes
under the 'parameters' object. This instructs the API internals to
update the existing sub-resource's attribute map rather than just
overwrite it. For internals see the logic in the extend_resources()
method in neutron.api.extensions [1]. For example the
qos_bw_limit_direction in neutron uses this approach for its
BANDWIDTH_LIMIT_RULES definition (also see related lib commit
I823f567ddf9c895eb3cf94e95ae34a382d67f51d).

This patch adds that support to the base api def test case and also
updates the contributor internals to document such. No release note
included since nothing changed from a consumption perspective.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/api/extensions.py#L350

Change-Id: Ib91004490dc3ca71b7caafe5cc3cb07417be1e4c

commit_message:
Refactor and clean up specs dir

- Follow new PTI building docs
- Add dir for Stein specs
- Remove skeleton.rst file because the template is enough
- Remove archive specs because they are invalid.
- Remove test_tiltles.py because it is useless (no actuall check
the spec files), instead, enable pep8 and waring-as-error for
.rst files, clear error those files.
- Add placeholder.rst for stein/rocky dir, if not they will
show error when building docs, delete them when it has
approved specs.

Change-Id: I8c387c0a480844b111562a9e77eac6ab26c58bce

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ansible host & venv bootstrap

The current ansible bootstrap process tried to
pin the versions of pip, setuptools and wheel
on the host and also uses inherited python
packages from the host. This causes problems
when the host has a version of setuptools which
is cannot be changed (perhaps due to some bug)
or when the host has otherwise undesirable
python packages.

The ansible bootstrap process only needs to
be concerned with whether pip is installed
and understands how to use constraints.

From there we can bootstrap the venv using
get-pip and completely avoid package conflicts
with the host. Once Ansible is bootstrapped,
the pip_install role will ensure that pip,
setuptools and wheel are correctly bootstrapped
and pinned across all hosts.

The pip_install role now uses constraints for
the initial get-pip [1], so we can also remove
the list of pip pins from group_vars.

We remove pip, setuptools and wheel from the
requirements.txt to allow the packages on the
host to be installed in the bootstrap without
forcing a change of pip/setuptools/wheel at the
same time (which causes failures in some
circumstances).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/483905

Change-Id: Ida84fb6bb726e1332f0e29ade51b67a5721f0785
(cherry picked from commit 5f7000e185fca71a5077ae7e2bcd29450c4cb70f)

on the host and also uses inherited python
packages from the host. This causes problems
when the host has a version of setuptools which
is cannot be changed (perhaps due to some bug)
or when the host has otherwise undesirable
python packages.

The ansible bootstrap process only needs to
be concerned with whether pip is installed
and understands how to use constraints.

From there we can bootstrap the venv using
get-pip and completely avoid package conflicts
with the host. Once Ansible is bootstrapped,
the pip_install role will ensure that pip,
setuptools and wheel are correctly bootstrapped
and pinned across all hosts.

The pip_install role now uses constraints for
the initial get-pip [1], so we can also remove
the list of pip pins from group_vars.

We remove pip, setuptools and wheel from the
requirements.txt to allow the packages on the
host to be installed in the bootstrap without
forcing a change of pip/setuptools/wheel at the
same time (which causes failures in some
circumstances).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/483905

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558811
Change-Id: Ida84fb6bb726e1332f0e29ade51b67a5721f0785
(cherry picked from commit 5f7000e185fca71a5077ae7e2bcd29450c4cb70f)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ansible host & venv bootstrap

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/484891
- https://review.openstack.org/485988

The current ansible bootstrap process tried to
pin the versions of pip, setuptools and wheel
on the host and also uses inherited python
packages from the host. This causes problems
when the host has a version of setuptools which
is cannot be changed (perhaps due to some bug)
or when the host has otherwise undesirable
python packages.

The ansible bootstrap process only needs to
be concerned with whether pip is installed
and understands how to use constraints.

From there we can bootstrap the venv using
get-pip and completely avoid package conflicts
with the host. Once Ansible is bootstrapped,
the pip_install role will ensure that pip,
setuptools and wheel are correctly bootstrapped
and pinned across all hosts.

The pip_install role now uses constraints for
the initial get-pip [1], so we can also remove
the list of pip pins from group_vars.

We remove pip, setuptools and wheel from the
requirements.txt to allow the packages on the
host to be installed in the bootstrap without
forcing a change of pip/setuptools/wheel at the
same time (which causes failures in some
circumstances).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/483905

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558811
Change-Id: Ida84fb6bb726e1332f0e29ade51b67a5721f0785
(cherry picked from commit 5f7000e185fca71a5077ae7e2bcd29450c4cb70f)

Update to support running benchmark on python3

Fixed a TypeError when running with python3, and also added
a 'benchmark3' target to run it on python3 explicitly.

commit_message:
Set fuse_limit to 15 instead of default 32

Modify parameter list for build_vscsi_mapping call and include
fuse_limit=15 instead of default 32.

This patchset includes the required code change and live
testing was completed with upto 19 boot volumes attached to vm.

Change-Id: Iff10363aadc26f0fdc3af4b386e8c4d0d5b4269d

commit_message:
When ceph-disk has failed, collect more data

It is possible that a race condition can cause ceph-disk
to fail when attempting to mount a device, as it has
already tried mounting it. When that, or other unforseen
events, happens, we want to collect more data.

Partial-Bug: 1746118
Change-Id: I9c09951dbeb0329a8b0fcc57e9351492ef20c42d

commit_message:
Storage: increase robustness of storage clean jobs

This PS increases the robustness of storage cleaning jobs by
precreating the service accounts and roles for the pod to consume,
and removes the potential for race conditions by removing the delete
hook.

Change-Id: I1f3c35fe2bd2a4325430e8025951349526f683af

commit_message:
Replace usage of 'user' by 'user_id'

DeprecationWarning: Using the 'user' argument is deprecated
in version '2.18' and will be removed in version '3.0'.
This patch set helps to get rid of above deprecation warning message
while running unit test.

Change-Id: I23fcbbdc31449fc9b0fdbb8f342148effab7dd98

commit_message:
Add ROCKY to deprecated releases

Keystone uses [0] for marking config settings as deprecated and currently
ROCKY is missing as an option.  This change adds it in to match previous
releases.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/default.py#L103

Change-Id: I180209bbb11ee56ff5a950df4c5cbe5759c349ac

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia95aa8f003151cbce870acc54f2053cbcfc6effb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix list_limit doesn't work correctly for domain

This patch changed the sql query for domain list
to ensure the return count is correct if list_limit
is set for resource.

Closes-bug: #1760521

Change-Id: I690a9815fe2c35e6191ab3ac789e34736e0d637c

Tryied recreating this through the API tests, and I'm still unsuccessful [0]. But I can recreate it manually =/

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/718199/"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-02 18:29:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

It looks like the root domain is being accounted for in the limit before it's being removed from response result. I was able to recreate this in both tests once I added the root domain [0]. Feel free to steal those test cases if you want. They're pretty much doing the same thing as what you wrote, but just in their own test that showcases the broken behavior and adding a bit more detail to the wip message.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/718201/"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-04-03 01:12:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@ayoung, @Lance, yeah, the list_limit doesn't work if the root_domain is counted. I'll copy Lance's test in the next PS."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-04-03 01:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-04-03 04:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-04-03 06:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:59:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

FYI I think it would be fine to include these tests with the main patch that fixes the bug. Generally I'd only expect to see WIP tests if you want to expose the bug but you don't think you can fix it any time soon. But if it's easier for you to keep them separate that's fine too :)"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Expose a bug that list_limit doesn't work correctly

The list_limit for domain list doesn't work
correctly. The return count will less than
list_limit if the sql query contains root domain

This patch expose this bug and it will be fixed
in the following patch.

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad<lbragstad@gmail.com>

Partial-bug: #1760521

Change-Id: Ib28793c97f1b730cb3b83b046e653a7b660af875

commit_message:
Fix parameter call for reproducer

--autorun does not require an extra parameter so it does not need a
shift after it. on the other hand --timeout needs one so $2 can be
popped out of the call list

Change-Id: If4a329d13a7e6f8a7573a09c8010a7e4cd675fa8

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: I6d7a9af234b7a8a6e83f9a730ffe1c4fd698786a

commit_message:
Switch from testrepository to stestr

This commit replaces the call to testr with stestr, and updates the
output files accordingly. This is necessary because tempest has moved
away from testrepository [1], which is resulting in empty files being
created.

Lastly, we update the functional tests to ensure the subunit results
files exist and are not empty.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/

Change-Id: I2496fccff1f51c586e999538232a4bcf0addbee5

commit_message:
Fix web-download fails with default node_staging_uri

Web-download import method fails to import image to backend if
'node_staging_uri' is not set in glance-api.conf (or when the value
ends with a '/', as the default setting does) due to "local variable
'separator' referenced before assignment" error.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I056fb7a1f7a7ef6bc14ea54133cf083b2b9d9920
Closes-Bug: #1753964

commit_message:
Remove duplicative implementation of temporary directories.

remotefs has grown its own context sensitive temporary directory
handling sometime in the past, which is non-optimal given there
is a simpler implementation in nova.utils. Move remotefs to that
implementation, thus removing an exec('rm').

Change-Id: I1b908b169a41027a9a73cb02317725a81e44a4cb
blueprint: execs-ive-had-a-few

commit_message:
Update cut_dict() to return no more than specified by length

This patch updates the cut_dict() method to ensure that it only
returns strings up to the length specified.

Change-Id: Iecc1bd4f4c67606eed209a762e4d692691a37161
Closes-Bug: 1760134
(cherry picked from commit 0090fe28e0e0be199d14f86328eb69c5f1a77109)

commit_message:
Adjust tripleo-ansible-inventory parameters.

When P->Q upgrade is started '--static-yaml-inventory' is not
available, and produces error:
 error: unrecognized arguments: --static-yaml-inventory

Pike's syntax has to be used during upgrade.

Change-Id: I1428191190df11c4cfe0fe2cfed276941e24487e

commit_message:
Adds Update Parameters Workflow

This patch adds a workflow to update the parameters in a given
deployment plan so the tripleo.parameters.update action does not
need to be called directly.  This patch also makes a small change
to the parameters.py file to mitigate a import overshadowing.

Change-Id: I4be0edabad934db6cc203dd45be98a0a3b5fc6e0
Partial-Bug: 1640436

messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:30:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Without this, the pep8 tox is failing for stable/queens with:

************* Module networking_ovn.cmd.neutron_ovn_db_sync_util
E: 20, 0: No name 'topics' in module 'neutron.common' (no-name-in-module)
ERROR: InvocationError: '/tmp/networking-ovn/tools/coding-checks.sh --pylint '"}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-04-05 11:31:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have to find the root cause.
This change in neutron repo went in master branch. Neutron queen's branch still has topics.py[1]. So networking-ovn should pull neutron queen's branch and not master.

Otherwise,  more patches landing in Neutron's master branch, networking-ovn stable branches become more unstable.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/stable/queens/neutron/common/topics.py"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-05 11:34:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

oops, yes, we should be pulling neutron/queens , are we really pulling master ? :o ':D"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thanks for the review folks, yeah apparently the tox_install.sh script was pulling the master branch instead of stable/queens. See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559066/'}]

commit_message:
use common agent topics from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.topics module was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit Ie88b84949cbd55a4e7ad06341aab77b286cdc485
This patch consumes it by using neutron-lib's version of the module in
prep for Ia4a4604c259ce862597de80c6deeb3d408bf0e95

Change-Id: Id930982c4c278f5c0f585fd2fb17eee04fe8e4d3
(cherry picked from commit 1190b3d540fda711126e90910d77de6d759ab8dc)

commit_message:
Remove race and simplify conntrack state management

This change:
* avoids creating lots of short-lived threads
  (because: why would we ?)
* adds a try/except block to be sure we can log
  any issue that would otherwise be hidden by
  spawn_n.
* changes class from Queue to LightQueue after
  eventlet.queue code inspection, since it's a
  little smaller and should be faster

Change-Id: Ic348c08af375099a919116188ae17d2017695ecb
Closes-Bug: 1750777
(cherry picked from commit 35c225aaa37ee685000bfa07a02e83481485138d)

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: dell-storagecenter-driver docs updated

Document has been updated to include direct connect support. The
Dell EMC SC driver can be configured to point at a Storage Center
directly rather than through a DSM aggregator. This addresses
minimum requirements and limitation.

Change-Id: I0a0095235685c8f6dc6d9cd88b27d454641da387

messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-23 00:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-03-23 04:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks much better, I guess ok to add additional tests in followup patch.

Thanks Brian!!!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-23 15:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks good Brian.

In your ML post you mentioned something about planning to add more tests. Is that still planned for this patch, or as a follow up?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-24 02:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-24 02:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Moar testing!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-03-26 04:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Excellent tests!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-26 12:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-26 13:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not convinced about this.

Not having default method nor a way to set one FE. via env variable is not going to improve that user experience. And I think that chage is the part where the bug is introduced that change is closing, so I'm not convinced the bug exists in the first place."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:36:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Some responses inline.  My feeling about removing the default import-method is that this command does a lot of stuff, and it's better to require the user to be explicit about what they expect to accomplish.  The default will create an image record, just like the image-create call does now, but if you're going to supply data, you need to explicitly state what import-method you are using.  I think this is a more extensible strategy."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Lets put this on the agenda for Thu'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-26 23:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-03-27 17:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Nice catch sean'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I updated the bug description with a workflow and log extract to illustrate the problem.  Also, comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We can discuss whether there should be an import-method default or not at this week's meeting.  I'm thinking ahead to when we replace the current image-create command with this command.  If you think of this as image-create, it's ambiguous for v2 because it could mean "create an image record" or "create a full-blown bootable image".  Right now, image-create with no --file or stdin just creates a record.  This is a bit more complex because there are several different import sources (and could be more if other methods are eventually added).  So I don't think it's too bad to have this command act the way it does on this patch (i.e., in order for it to accept data, you have to specify which import-method you are using).  I focused on the import-method instead of --file or --uri because there could eventually be other import methods using --file or --uri.  Also, i think it's easier for consumers to use: first decide what method I want to use, then decide what arguments I need to supply to the call.  But like I said, I'm flexible about that.  We definitely need to add something like the series of tests on this patch, though.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

BTW, see https://review.openstack.org/557382 for a test that shows one problem situation that arises from the current glanceclient master.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> We can discuss whether there should be an import-method default or
 > not at this week's meeting.  I'm thinking ahead to when we replace
 > the current image-create command with this command.  If you think
 > of this as image-create, it's ambiguous for v2 because it could
 > mean "create an image record" or "create a full-blown bootable
 > image".  Right now, image-create with no --file or stdin just
 > creates a record.  This is a bit more complex because there are
 > several different import sources (and could be more if other
 > methods are eventually added).  So I don't think it's too bad to
 > have this command act the way it does on this patch (i.e., in order
 > for it to accept data, you have to specify which import-method you
 > are using).  I focused on the import-method instead of --file or
 > --uri because there could eventually be other import methods using
 > --file or --uri.  Also, i think it's easier for consumers to use:
 > first decide what method I want to use, then decide what arguments
 > I need to supply to the call.  But like I said, I'm flexible about
 > that.  We definitely need to add something like the series of tests
 > on this patch, though.

I do not like removing the default for exactly the same reason. Once we have stabilized deployments the swap would be seamless for the end user ... exactly the same command would work and do the same thing, only using different mechanism to achieve the image creation.

If we do not keep the default and change the name, we will break literally everyone and I've gone through that already once too many times.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Revised according to what we discussed at today's Glance meeting.

There's no test for the env var setting because utils.env will put the value into args.import_method, so there's no way to tell from within the function whether or not the value came from an env var.  I think the tests in tests/unit/test_shell.py that check the env vars show us that utils.env work as expected, though."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-04-03 05:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Covered as per discussion in meeting.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-04-03 12:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Couple of minor things but in general this looks really nicely covering all the aspects.

Thanks Brian!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

New PS up shortly.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I realized that the 2 backward-compat tests I added would pass even if the code wasn't doing what it was supposed to.  This patch beefs those up and while I was in there, I improved the web-download test."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-04-04 17:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Make image-create-via-import fail faster

Add checks to the image-create-via-import commmand so that it provides
better user feedback and doesn't begin the import workflow unless the
input has a chance of succeeding.  Preserves backward compatibility
with the current image-create command by (1) allowing an image record
only to be created when no import-method is specified AND no data is
supplied, and (2) doing the glance-direct workflow when no import-
method is specified AND data is provided.  Also adds the ability for
the import-method to be set as an env var OS_IMAGE_IMPORT_METHOD.

Change-Id: I0a225f5471a9311217b5d90ebb5fd415c369129a
Closes-bug: #1758149

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 11:39:46.000000000', 'message': "Noauth should also use request_id from compute_req_id.py

When using noauth midlleware, the context is generated here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ef6f4e4c8ec82e2c9f9988fe2e04591ee01220e6/nova/api/openstack/auth.py#L56
as the openstack.request_id from req.environ, previously created in:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.middleware/blob/master/oslo_middleware/request_id.py#L57
was not included in the initialize of the context obj, nova will generate
a new request_id for context obj.

As the req.environ['openstack.request_id'] will latter returned to user as
the 'x-openstack-request-id'
field in the response header, users may use this for searching etc. But
the latter Nova workflow will
all use the context.request_id, which will lead to an inconsistency
problem.

Change-Id: I047b5f66b33ac89b2b5e9170c12bc87d76d0946b
Closes-Bug: #1758031
"}, {'created': '2018-03-27 07:18:38.000000000', 'message': "Noauth should also use request_id from compute_req_id.py

context.request_id, which will lead to an inconsistency problem.

Change-Id: I047b5f66b33ac89b2b5e9170c12bc87d76d0946b
Closes-Bug: #1758031
"}]
commit_message:
Noauth should also use request_id from compute_req_id.py

When using noauth midlleware, the context is generated here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ef6f4e4c8ec82e2c9f9988fe2e04591ee01220e6/nova/api/openstack/auth.py#L56
as the openstack.request_id from req.environ, previously created in:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.middleware/blob/master/oslo_middleware/request_id.py#L57
was not included in the initialize of the context obj,
oslo_context.context.Context.__init__ will generate a new request_id for
context obj.

As the req.environ['openstack.request_id'] will later be returned to the
user as the 'x-openstack-request-id' field in the response header, users
may use this for searching etc. But the Nova workflow will all use the
context.request_id, which will lead to an inconsistency problem.

Change-Id: I047b5f66b33ac89b2b5e9170c12bc87d76d0946b
Closes-Bug: #1758031
