commit_message:
Added Liquidio service definition in overcloud puppet registry

LiquidioCompute nodes use OS::TripleO::Services::LiquidioCompute
to apply necessary configuration. This service declaration is
currently missing in overcloud puppet service registry file.
Without this declaration, respective role can not be used.

Change-Id: I17af0945feb5be2450dbcd4f29f861d57d2db205
Closes-Bug: 1760544

commit_message:
zuul: Restore periodic jobs for openSUSE

openSUSE basekit jobs are voting now so we know that the core
functionality is working fine. As such, lets add the full LXC job back
and also add the ceph one so we can look for failures and improve the
overall status of the distribution.

Change-Id: I6d61ff943392e82524c00f7203c57a5272010fc6

commit_message:
Do not expect python-nova

In Debian, there's no such thing anymore as the python-nova package,
but a new python3-nova. This patch removes such expectation. The
manifest shouldn't even attempt to install it anyway.

Change-Id: I5a3f1a2416b103374146eb24c3d7c942a834a066

commit_message:
Defaults to parent_resource name correctly

When name attribute of deployment is an empty
string, dict.get will return that empty string
instead of returning the default value set in
the second param of dict.get(first, second).
This patch fixes it by returning the default
value.

Change-Id: I7b48414fd18e01594f6d9b0d106c2abb71b7f676
Related-Bug: #1755078
(cherry picked from commit 204947c9084f9b85d7377e389a2500da48cdf2d8)

This commit adds support for connect_method fixed in case of
standalone ironic. Previously it supported only floating_ip.

commit_message:
Fix onboarding link

The onboarding link was not explicit and caused an anchor issue
with doc8 [1].

This should fix it.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/78/558878/2/check/openstack-ansible-linters/3bcf40f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-05_04_08_37_863690

Change-Id: I5e0282f2899f26c220193ab77760684cebd22f39

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.19

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Ic23142b0034c6c47dde16bce5b119d345553efa5
Change-Id: I99e3eb3710393d127c4bcb0bcb8f1eecfcd35730

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ibf272b8472d9baa1a0c2a278e3c45aab787c8ef7
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for newton-eol

This patch updates all the roles to their EOL tag,
copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, and mark the version of this repo as EOL.

The linters check has been disabled from the gates because
it fails in gates while it doesn't fail on a development
machine. It's too late now to change any code now that
the roles are EOL anyway.

Change-Id: I885a0b645a18267b3bbe133d87bca9ed2e589312

commit_message:
Introduce variable to allow different DVR modes

This feature replaces splitting of compute hosts into inner
and external with a new variable 'neutron_compute_dvr_mode'
that controls whether computes will have full-blown DVR or
internal only (tenant) networking.

Change-Id: I6720ccfcfcec89f9996d4cb5ae60f31eb3113667
Implements: blueprint dvr-mode-property

commit_message:
Add always tag where it's needed

When running the nova role with the "nova-config" tag the role will
result in failure due to registered variables not being available. This
change simply adds the always tag where it's needed so that the various
tags in the os_nova role can work together or independently.

Change-Id: Id5e8dd2df3c0cbf7cc2e0cf20b5731928dd6a18d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector public endpoint

Fixes a bug where the Baremetal Introspection service's public endpoint
registered in the Identity service referenced the internal API endpoint.

Also updates keystone endpoints for the Baremetal and Baremetal
Introspection services during reconfigure and upgrade operations.
Previously this was only done during deploy.

Change-Id: I32d475f288bb4a3834c13cc86f0c53b5437c3d25
Closes-Bug: #1738418
(cherry picked from commit dda24c47bcc0df3695630fd473864c36cf487989)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-30 15:59:06.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "FFU: Add support for panko service upgrade"

This reverts commit bd48087520c5f0846363bdc0c025508ba450ceb3.

After further inspection It seems that panko dbsync shouldn't be needed, as it will upgrade an newly empty db.  

And this is assuming we have a way to:
 - configure panko database connection properly
 - create the db

So all that to upgrade a newly (I guess empty) database seems like too much trouble.

The db will be created in the last step of the FFU. 

Change-Id: Ie68849a7033c199c339d28cdb10c3dba9419904b
Related-Bug: #1760135
'}, {'created': '2018-03-30 17:35:50.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "FFU: Add support for panko service upgrade"

This reverts commit bd48087520c5f0846363bdc0c025508ba450ceb3.

After further inspection It seems that panko dbsync shouldn't be
needed, as it will upgrade an newly created empty db.

And this is assuming we find a way to:
 - configure panko database connection properly
 - create the db

Knowing that we don't have access to this information[1] as the
new hieradata haven't been rendered at this stage.

So all that to upgrade a newly (I guess empty) database seems like too
much trouble.

The db will be created in the last step of the FFU.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/ocata/puppet/services/panko-base.yaml#L39..L75

Change-Id: Ie68849a7033c199c339d28cdb10c3dba9419904b
Closes-Bug: #1760135
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "FFU: Add support for panko service upgrade"

This reverts commit bd48087520c5f0846363bdc0c025508ba450ceb3.

After further inspection It seems that panko dbsync shouldn't be
needed, as it will upgrade an newly created empty db.

And this is assuming we find a way to:
 - configure panko database connection properly
 - create the db

Knowing that we don't have access to this information[1] as the
new hieradata haven't been rendered at this stage.

So all that to upgrade a newly (I guess empty) database seems like too
much trouble.

The db will be created in the last step of the FFU.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/ocata/puppet/services/panko-base.yaml#L39..L75

Change-Id: Ie68849a7033c199c339d28cdb10c3dba9419904b
Closes-Bug: #1760135

commit_message:
Move configurable mkfs to privsep.

Nova allows deployers to configure the command line which is used to create
a filesystem of a given type. This is frankly a little bit weird, but its
also historical. Move this functionality to privsep, including doing a
dance at startup to load config flags into privsep in a hopefully secure
manner.

Honestly, all of this code should be deprecated, but that's above my pay
grade and would take time to do. Oh, and maybe deployers love it the way
it is.

Change-Id: Id8eeb21e10f98a448946f178c8c5a36e48c7cac6
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
Extract a devstack-minimal base job

For folks who are doing functional testing with less than the full set
of normal base services. Should be a no-op/ignorable for most people.

Change-Id: If14ee018c01995e0a5b6bcdaac9ddc8810c6d503

[{'created': '2018-04-04 19:40:35.000000000', 'message': "Run with KVM if we can in tests

We should not Set nova_virt_type.
This way detection steps in, and kvm is used.

However, we should use qemu for OVH hosts:
There seem to be a bug in some OVH hosts
causing 'hardware error 0x0' when trying to run with kvm.

Change-Id: I4f679815ac55095000dc1017cebbd1a8bf0f6c5f
(cherry picked from commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0)
"}]
commit_message:
Run with KVM if we can in tests

We should not Set nova_virt_type.
This way detection steps in, and kvm is used.

However, we should use qemu for OVH hosts:
There seem to be a bug in some OVH hosts
causing 'hardware error 0x0' when trying to run with kvm.

Change-Id: I4f679815ac55095000dc1017cebbd1a8bf0f6c5f
(cherry picked from commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0)

commit_message:
Implement skipping of networks

This adds the ipsec_skip_networks option which will not add the
ipsec tunnels for the specified networks.

Change-Id: I82cf1e1e81f364eb689507da46f52ba1877e0659
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <rmascena@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 16:06:29.000000000', 'message': 'Correct CentOS mirror URL

The mirror URL provided by the OpenStack-CI mirror script
gives a result which includes the trailing /centos. We
should ensure that we expect that, but also provide a
sensible default for outside OpenStack-CI.

Change-Id: I476614bb8a77214e933c44c89fe8687cdafcc09e
'}]
commit_message:
Correct CentOS mirror URL

The mirror URL provided by the OpenStack-CI mirror script
gives a result which includes the trailing /centos. We
should ensure that we expect that, but also provide a
sensible default for outside OpenStack-CI.

Change-Id: I476614bb8a77214e933c44c89fe8687cdafcc09e

commit_message:
Add new DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE var

With latest there is a need to export the DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE var,
that in our case needs to be set to mbr.

Change-Id: I45dc7a48f6ec681655cf9021f260d9c458ff3a6a

commit_message:
Replace usage of '/v1/report/total' by '/v1/report/summary'

[cloudkitty.api.v1.controllers.report] /v1/report/total is deprecated.
This patch set helps to get rid of above deprecation warning message
while running unit test.

Change-Id: Idcd0fad75dc29d01d21ebfea3cc2c266dc7ec4e0

Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files

Change-Id: I3d329ec9d7f34ef4a2ce973a20731c7720cfc7d5

commit_message:
Non-lvm iscsi backends should run iscsid on compute and storage nodes

Cinder backends that utilize iSCSI protocol require iscsid on
compute and storage nodes to handle volumes and their backups.

Change-Id: I1c735d2abace4b46879be99731ead47d578335ea
Closes-Bug: #1725258
(cherry picked from commit 8d429fc1e1ce68609abeb71b8bd2a858be85424a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-01 11:38:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add common_options to keystone container check

keystone_* containers are created via the kolla_docker ansible module
with common_options set to docker_common_options. However, when the
containers are checked, common_options are not passed to the
kolla_docker ansible module. This can cause the keystone_* containers
to be restarted during a reconfigure when there are no changes to
keystone configuration.

Add the common_options argument to the kolla_docker ansible module when
checking the keystone containers and set it to docker_common_options.

Change-Id: I44aefcf3d71faecaf1ffe384fd5a2f611e584a37
Closes-Bug: #1759922
(cherry picked from commit 735012c4bb4aaf83aa2eaadefde7b8b0a4674397)
'}]
commit_message:
Add common_options to keystone container check

keystone_* containers are created via the kolla_docker ansible module
with common_options set to docker_common_options. However, when the
containers are checked, common_options are not passed to the
kolla_docker ansible module. This can cause the keystone_* containers
to be restarted during a reconfigure when there are no changes to
keystone configuration.

Add the common_options argument to the kolla_docker ansible module when
checking the keystone containers and set it to docker_common_options.

Change-Id: I44aefcf3d71faecaf1ffe384fd5a2f611e584a37
Closes-Bug: #1759922
(cherry picked from commit 735012c4bb4aaf83aa2eaadefde7b8b0a4674397)

commit_message:
Add common_options to keystone container check

keystone_* containers are created via the kolla_docker ansible module
with common_options set to docker_common_options. However, when the
containers are checked, common_options are not passed to the
kolla_docker ansible module. This can cause the keystone_* containers
to be restarted during a reconfigure when there are no changes to
keystone configuration.

Add the common_options argument to the kolla_docker ansible module when
checking the keystone containers and set it to docker_common_options.

Change-Id: I44aefcf3d71faecaf1ffe384fd5a2f611e584a37
Closes-Bug: #1759922
(cherry picked from commit 735012c4bb4aaf83aa2eaadefde7b8b0a4674397)

the hc_exc.CommandError exception will only be hit when environment file is rendered via j2 template and -e path is NOT started with user_tht_root(/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/).

commit_message:
WIP: FFU upgrade to Queens OVS during Newton minor update

[newton only] Adds a SoftwareConfig at the end of the minor
update workflow i.e. after ControllerPostPuppet, to enable the
Q repos and install the latest openvswitch

TBD: which repo will provide ovs 2.8.x for the latest Q?

Depends-On: Ib681729cc2728ca4b0486c14166b6b702edfcaab
Change-Id: I725a974e4b71ee6a6cc0b1225e29516700816cf5

subject: Adds pre-upgrade validations using the new pre-upgrade hook

commit_message:
Adds pre-upgrade validations using the new pre-upgrade hook

In If7c2f5f5a904d570b2f2fbe4eea3f8fd7162afb9 a new pre-upgrade
entrypoint was added so operators no longer have to manually bring
services down. As discussed in the parent review
I32330a05fa142fc92d73f68103429c4c2c1816ab we can invoke the
pre-upgrade validation group here.

Change-Id: I02c1a6cee25f8e65bb03ac85fe794762fd40bf09

commit_message:
Add --templates by defaut in overcloud upgrade prepare/converge

Unless operator sets --templates or --answers-file then default
to --templates and the default THT location in a utils function

Change-Id: I8feb2b38b0fc032cd1f4d4636a4380b01c51ec05

[{'created': '2018-04-03 16:04:23.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh keystone after deployment

This is necessary for certain setups (such as enabling multiple LDAP
domains). So, instead of always adding checks every time to see if
we need to refresh or not, lets just do it always, thus simplifying
the already convoluted logic here.

Change-Id: Ie1a0b9740ed18663451a3907ec3e3575adb4e778
Closes-Bug: #1748219
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <rmascena@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refresh keystone after deployment

This is necessary for certain setups (such as enabling multiple LDAP
domains). So, instead of always adding checks every time to see if
we need to refresh or not, lets just do it always, thus simplifying
the already convoluted logic here.

Change-Id: Ie1a0b9740ed18663451a3907ec3e3575adb4e778
Closes-Bug: #1748219
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <rmascena@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ffc14e3067e6eb0039dceec9656f07d7663dc87f)

commit_message:
Enable OVN HA profile in fset28

The required ovs version 2.7.2 which supports OVN HA deployment
is available in RDO.

[{'created': '2018-04-05 07:28:22.000000000', 'message': "Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html

Change-Id: I51691f9ebefd7b03c41cdcec53c5620f7c1e3889

commit_message:
Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Change-Id: I51691f9ebefd7b03c41cdcec53c5620f7c1e3889

commit_message:
Don't pass history with message actions

It is now possible to access history in action creators via
utils/history module, so it is not neccessary to pass history
via ZaqarActions

Change-Id: I9cb8f297fb189dec69ad72dc0c8d2ce1465ff042

subject: nova: wait until all nova-compute services are up
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2276, 'name': 'Jorge Niedbalski', 'email': 'jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com', 'username': 'niedbalski'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 21284, 'name': 'Pavel Gluschak (scsnow)', 'email': 'pglushchak@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'scsnow'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23717, 'name': 'Surya Prakash Singh', 'email': 'singh.surya64mnnit@gmail.com', 'username': 'SuryaPrakash'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21284, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2276, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks Pavel.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-04-04 06:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

we only need one compute host to do the cells, other hosts will be discovered automatically when started based on https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2#L250

If we rely on all hosts, if one of them fails because some issue, the deployment will fail.

The wait in the task is just to give time to execute the first discover_hosts command with a node (minimum required by nova)'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-04-05 06:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> we only need one compute host to do the cells, other hosts will be
 > discovered automatically when started based on https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2#L250
 > 
 > If we rely on all hosts, if one of them fails because some issue,
 > the deployment will fail.
 > 
 > The wait in the task is just to give time to execute the first
 > discover_hosts command with a node (minimum required by nova)

 > we only need one compute host to do the cells, other hosts will be
 > discovered automatically when started based on https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2#L250
 > 
 > If we rely on all hosts, if one of them fails because some issue,
 > the deployment will fail.
 > 
 > The wait in the task is just to give time to execute the first
 > discover_hosts command with a node (minimum required by nova)

well explained @egonzalez, nova need one node to be up to discover hosts for cell setup'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-05 07:57:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think it would help if there was a bug detailing the issue that this is attempting to resolve.'}, {'account_id': 21284, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, I see, that discover_hosts_in_cells_interval is set, so kolla-ansible relies on auto discover. No need to wait for all nova-compute hosts up then.'}, {'account_id': 21284, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 17:11:42.000000000', 'message': 'nova: wait until all nova-compute services are up

We need to ensure, that all nova-compute services are
up before discovering hosts for cell setup.

Change-Id: Ie9aa01074d35d61e8672f73bfb59691fabceed09
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
'}]
commit_message:
nova: wait until all nova-compute services are up

We need to ensure, that all nova-compute services are
up before discovering hosts for cell setup.

Change-Id: Ie9aa01074d35d61e8672f73bfb59691fabceed09
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

subject: WIP Optionally run config download at the end of stack create/update
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 07:51:58.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Optionally run config download at the end of stack create/update

Introduce a boolean input to the deploy workflow to have it
run the config_download workflow once the stack create/update has
completed.

Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ied0f9422473bdf6d4fedd061c292725edd33feaa

Use enable_ssh_admin_ssh

Change-Id: I3e44cd452a812572a3b5b15c6df8b97eef6ed1a9
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Optionally run config download at the end of stack create/update

Introduce a boolean input to the deploy workflow to have it
run the config_download workflow once the stack create/update has
completed.

Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ied0f9422473bdf6d4fedd061c292725edd33feaa

Use enable_ssh_admin_ssh

Change-Id: I3e44cd452a812572a3b5b15c6df8b97eef6ed1a9

commit_message:
[www-index-langs] Adjusts landing title width

Language landing pages are needed to reflect one of
changes in I4fd1c345dfd3debd14167839c1b93c69a3d3027e
- Changing from 9 to 8 for col-lg/md/sm-* in the left part
(other things are automatically inherited from css
and template files).

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 21:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-05 06:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-05 06:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 21:56:19.000000000', 'message': 'add unreleased_version_title configuration option

Added configuration option ``unreleased_version_title`` with
associated Sphinx directive argument to control whether to show the
computed version number for changes that have not been tagged, or to
show a static title string specified in the option value.

Change-Id: I3069a008451e93cb62e5e43611cf62de5026952f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add unreleased_version_title configuration option

Added configuration option ``unreleased_version_title`` with
associated Sphinx directive argument to control whether to show the
computed version number for changes that have not been tagged, or to
show a static title string specified in the option value.

Change-Id: I3069a008451e93cb62e5e43611cf62de5026952f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update amulet test definitions

Enable Queens, and set Queens as the smoke gate

Remove Mitaka test target (not published as tested
or recommended).

Change-Id: I634d8960803133d2dfca1961f7b482a268b995aa

commit_message:
Copy certifications info octavia housekeeping and health manager container

octavia-housekeeping container need certifications to create spare
amphore instances.

octavia-health-manager container need certifications to create stable
amphore instances.

Change-Id: I90b9c4c39f6542bb1ee5f40a8d0a39ae8d0ab2b0
Closes-Bug: #1719063
(cherry picked from commit ef85df2335f21b82c04e752e039b30d45b4483ab)

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Prevent usage of unsafe volumes

It is possible for thick volumes, created from storage pools
which have zero-padding disabled, to contain previous data. This
change prevents these volumes from being created by default. A
user can override this behavior by acknowleding the possibility
with a configuration option.

Change-Id: I62f8f48b1624fc9abb7427bd4ca51f7873d35b96
Closes-bug: #1699573

[{'created': '2018-04-03 21:20:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add --enable flag to replace/find_and_replace subcommands

Now you can issue a single

   swift-manage-shard-ranges "$DB" find_and_replace --enable

Change-Id: I41c2bc297817f75d7159f0e183c4f209c40c1d0b

commit_message:
Add --enable flag to replace/find_and_replace subcommands

Now you can issue a single

   swift-manage-shard-ranges "$DB" find_and_replace --enable

command to kick off manual sharding.

Change-Id: I41c2bc297817f75d7159f0e183c4f209c40c1d0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 17:23:18.000000000', 'message': "skip complex comparison for constraints without markers

We're seeing parse errors on constraints with no markers, possibly
related to a unicode issue (it only seems to happen when the empty
marker string is a unicode string). There isn't any point in doing an
expensive comparison when there are no markers for the constraint, so
skip them in that part of the search loop.

Change-Id: I2a700fb8f3e776faf6123c9924d87add12324ef2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
skip complex comparison for constraints without markers

We're seeing parse errors on constraints with no markers, possibly
related to a unicode issue (it only seems to happen when the empty
marker string is a unicode string). There isn't any point in doing an
expensive comparison when there are no markers for the constraint, so
skip them in that part of the search loop.

Change-Id: I2a700fb8f3e776faf6123c9924d87add12324ef2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
stop requiring comments to match global-requirements.txt

Requiring the comments after the version numbers to match seems
overly pedantic.

Change-Id: Ia9d94ea194128dff867cd069488773454ba121ce
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 13:58:54.000000000', 'message': 'report all attributes that do not match exactly

Previous versions of the loop stopped looking at exact-match
attributes when one failed. By removing the break statement we can
report all match failures in a single run of the test job.

Change-Id: I419f3a611bfc6cc17272382e1b4f00534a5eb5ae
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
report all attributes that do not match exactly

Previous versions of the loop stopped looking at exact-match
attributes when one failed. By removing the break statement we can
report all match failures in a single run of the test job.

Change-Id: I419f3a611bfc6cc17272382e1b4f00534a5eb5ae
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 13:58:54.000000000', 'message': 'avoid testing exact matches twice

Without this patch we test the attributes that have to match exactly
two separate times, once to report which do not match and again to see
if they all match before testing the exclusions.

With this patch we only test the attributes one time and if we fail to
match one we do not test them again.

Change-Id: Ida4fe5d14acfbd5f72a722037270df7c88a760d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
avoid testing exact matches twice

Without this patch we test the attributes that have to match exactly
two separate times, once to report which do not match and again to see
if they all match before testing the exclusions.

With this patch we only test the attributes one time and if we fail to
match one we do not test them again.

Change-Id: Ida4fe5d14acfbd5f72a722037270df7c88a760d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

in this series:

commit_message:
Default to py3 for the pep8 tox env because it's stricter

We recently fixed a couple of pep8 failures under py3 [0] which got
through because we're not gating pep8 on py3. This changes the python
version for the pep8 tox env to python3 because the py3 checks are
stricter. This updates the fast8 tox env as well.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557633

Change-Id: I540377606a8224ba569b8c145773e7d057575bd8

commit_message:
Update uuid.uuid4() to uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Since oslo.utils provide the ability to generate the uuid string,
and some others use oslo.utils[0] too. For consistency, this ps
replaces uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid().

missing from Ide5cdaf48a27e9c080fd8691b100a601f82ca2bf

Change-Id: Ia9b8cda25252b70d3706c23e402ae81ccf48e33e

commit_message:
Fix claims on non-existing queue on swift

This returns an empty list instead of an error if we try to claim
messages on a queue that doesn't exist yet.

Change-Id: Ia92774ef1c55a371e37fc845511a5dceb8f92c00
Closes-Bug: #1754061
(cherry picked from commit df24b8b0238b019f0c2437a1074b69e19e3d0342)

commit_message:
Deallocate the VIP prior to deleting the amphorae

This patch changes the load balancer delete flow order to deallocate the VIP
port(s) prior to deleting the amphorae. This resolves an issue where an
initial delete fails due to a neutron outage.

Change-Id: Ifcfdba1d28aa732d0f7b3b0a8bffb58cee0ab7cc
Story: 2001523
Task: 6325
(cherry picked from commit 87c233fd402397d918e85d774f9e298ff0751a4f)

commit_message:
Remove the 'auto' network mode from help text

The 'auto' mode is not yet supported. However, it is in the help
text of the CLI which causes confusion. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I31f4b3f4731292f8ec0973e1dab55005f58df5e5

subject: Properly use TLS in Django for email
messages: [{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-04-05 01:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-04-05 01:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 01:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Properly use TLS in Django for email

This setting has been missing for quite some time and
needs to be added. While it is mostly assumed Adjutant
is running on the same network as the email server itself
TLS should really always have been used. We now have the
setting to properly turn this on and use it.

Change-Id: Ib6d54829d58df87a4b606ca316052418f5a1cfa5
'}]
commit_message:
Properly use TLS in Django for email

This setting has been missing for quite some time and
needs to be added. While it is mostly assumed Adjutant
is running on the same network as the email server itself
TLS should really always have been used. We now have the
setting to properly turn this on and use it.

Change-Id: Ib6d54829d58df87a4b606ca316052418f5a1cfa5

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I83c748ade7d768639e1a20b761e03881e8c1d6ed

You'll have to do a little more than just find and replace to get this updated.

This effort was proposed at least once before and shot down. Oslo.log provides a layer that makes this less of an issue. You may want to get input from jokke and/or romaita as to whether this is something they want before spending much more time on it.

My 2 cents is I think it would be good to just get this updated and out of the way. That would prevent it being reproposed every few months and it would eliminate any confusion from folks who know warn() is going away."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-04-04 17:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

commit_message:
Update pip_install role and work around OVH nested-virt issues

This patch combines the following patches in the hope
that these crucial fixes together may pass both check
and gate pipelines more successfully than just the first
on its own.

- https://review.openstack.org/558229
- https://review.openstack.org/558878

Change-Id: Id2e80b92a703bf543d309d6b2eb4df9bb377d24d

commit_message:
Install Horizon from git repository in tox test

To test UI plugins, we should install recent Horizon
from master branch like CI infra does.

Also, this patch adds new testenv:py35dj20, due to
Horizon has plan to bump Django version to 2.0.

And new testenv:jstests for eslint and karma is added.

To run tox test easily before upload patchset,
adds py35dj20, jstests, docs and releasenotes to envlist.

Change-Id: I9f111c1d2a70e87f60e9901e6070d05e3dc1a76d

commit_message:
Change back to using vpn_agent.ini

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555167/ merged
downstream packaging jobs broke due to the filename
change to l3_agent.ini.  Change it back to vpn_agent.ini
since it could cause an upgrade issue.

Also, since l3_agent.ini is already used in the neutron
tree, having a file with the same name could cause some
confusion, so it's better to use something unique.

Change-Id: I39cf2c0d1c54e7c292dcdf71831c1a3cbc67284a

[{'created': '2018-03-26 07:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'Schedule gateway on chassis from ovn-cms-options

Admin sets ovn-cms-options in external_ids as

ovs-vsctl set open .
   external_ids:ovn-cms-options="enable-chassis-as-gw"

to enable a chassis as a candidate for scheduling gateway router.
Networking-ovn will parse ovn-cms-options and select this chassis
if it has proper bridge mappings.

This helps admin to exclude compute nodes to host gateway routers as
they are more likely to be restarted for maintenance operations.

We follow this order for selecting candidates
1) candidates with ovn-cms-options and proper bridge mappings
2) if no candidates from 1), then chassis with proper
   bridge mappings

Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/refarch/refarch.rst

Closes-bug: #1743745
Change-Id: I86fbe27f0b6a9317ad82c2bcf2a0446d118de35b
'}]
commit_message:
Schedule gateway on chassis from ovn-cms-options

Admin sets ovn-cms-options in external_ids as

ovs-vsctl set open .
   external_ids:ovn-cms-options="enable-chassis-as-gw"

to enable a chassis as a candidate for scheduling gateway router.
Networking-ovn will parse ovn-cms-options and select this chassis
if it has proper bridge mappings.

This helps admin to exclude compute nodes to host gateway routers as
they are more likely to be restarted for maintenance operations.

We follow this order for selecting candidates
1) candidates with ovn-cms-options and proper bridge mappings
2) if no candidates from 1), then chassis with proper
   bridge mappings

Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/refarch/refarch.rst

Closes-bug: #1743745
Change-Id: I86fbe27f0b6a9317ad82c2bcf2a0446d118de35b

commit_message:
Refresh keystone after deployment

This is necessary for certain setups (such as enabling multiple LDAP
domains). So, instead of always adding checks every time to see if
we need to refresh or not, lets just do it always, thus simplifying
the already convoluted logic here.

Change-Id: Ie1a0b9740ed18663451a3907ec3e3575adb4e778
Closes-Bug: #1748219
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <rmascena@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ffc14e3067e6eb0039dceec9656f07d7663dc87f)

subject: Copy deleted shard ranges from old db to new db
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'message': "Copy deleted shard ranges from old db to new db

When creating a fresh epoch db, ensure that all shard ranges are
copied from the old db, including deleted shard ranges. Otherwise an
old, previously deleted shard range may re-appear.

This bug manifested in probe/test_sharder.py/test_shrinking as
follows:

In the first cycle of the test, a container is sharded and then all
shards shrink back to the original root container, meaning that the
final shard range expands to the entire namespace before shrinking and
being deleted.

On the next cycle the container grows again and when searching for
shrink candidates a state version, active, of the old deleted final
shard range would re-appear in the root shard range table, because
there was no record of it being deleted.  This range would appear as
an upper neighbour of a shrinkable donor range and be chosen as
acceptor in preference to the real upper neighbour of the donor.

For example, given two correct ranges '' - 'obj024' and 'obj024' - '',
plus a rogue range '' - '', the rogue range would sort between the two
correct ranges and therefore be chosen as an acceptor for the donor ''
- 'obj024'.

The bug has become apparent since the related change [1] because prior
to [1] the rogue shard range would have sorted before the donor and
therefore not be chosen as an acceptor.

[1] Related-Change: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924

Change-Id: If29370fc70485e7510fabbd30d9214295c8156be
"}]
commit_message:
Copy deleted shard ranges from old db to new db

When creating a fresh epoch db, ensure that all shard ranges are
copied from the old db, including deleted shard ranges. Otherwise an
old, previously deleted shard range may re-appear.

This bug manifested in probe/test_sharder.py/test_shrinking as
follows:

In the first cycle of the test, a container is sharded and then all
shards shrink back to the original root container, meaning that the
final shard range expands to the entire namespace before shrinking and
being deleted.

On the next cycle the container grows again and when searching for
shrink candidates a state version, active, of the old deleted final
shard range would re-appear in the root shard range table, because
there was no record of it being deleted.  This range would appear as
an upper neighbour of a shrinkable donor range and be chosen as
acceptor in preference to the real upper neighbour of the donor.

For example, given two correct ranges '' - 'obj024' and 'obj024' - '',
plus a rogue range '' - '', the rogue range would sort between the two
correct ranges and therefore be chosen as an acceptor for the donor ''
- 'obj024'.

The bug has become apparent since the related change [1] because prior
to [1] the rogue shard range would have sorted before the donor and
therefore not be chosen as an acceptor.

[1] Related-Change: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924

Change-Id: If29370fc70485e7510fabbd30d9214295c8156be

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 08:47:21.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Developer docs refactor

This refactor has the intent of guiding a new OpenStack-Ansible
user towards his first contributions.

The deploy guide is now pointing towards the Developer Guide,
but there is was no guidance given, just a series of topics.

Here, the first page of the developer guide is an onboarding
page, explaining our repos, what's inside them, and how to
contribute. It then links towards all the sections, which
had to be restructured to match a wizard-style flow.

Change-Id: Ib2a5f2063c4dc58fc249ac94c3cd85bb281f28a5
"}, {'created': '2018-03-29 10:44:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Developer docs refactor

This refactor has the intent of guiding a new OpenStack-Ansible
user towards his first contributions.

The deploy guide is now pointing towards the Developer Guide,
but there is was no guidance given, just a series of topics.

Here, the first page of the developer guide is an onboarding
page, explaining our repos, what's inside them, and how to

commit_message:
Developer docs refactor

This refactor has the intent of guiding a new OpenStack-Ansible
user towards his first contributions.

The deploy guide is now pointing towards the Developer Guide,
but there is was no guidance given, just a series of topics.

Here, the first page of the developer guide is an onboarding
page, explaining our repos, what's inside them, and how to
contribute. It then links towards all the sections, which
had to be restructured to match a wizard-style flow.

Change-Id: Ib2a5f2063c4dc58fc249ac94c3cd85bb281f28a5

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.2

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Ie841216c4bb7d8b5727a0d633b603d4f64172a63
Change-Id: I4ad515b9a63948fd522a3fc6fc38ab7b2da3f7ab

commit_message:
Stop using populate_ml2_config in devstack plugin

It's not defined when lib/neutron is used to deploy neutron services.

Change-Id: I770c5e44e5fc54c7cfbb8b1342082095f80cee83

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 21:42:46.000000000', 'message': 'Execute full suite with default concurrency

We have full-serial to run those tests serially. Having full also
serial, we effectively ignore --concurrency argument that may be passed
with posargs, like neutron-tempest-linuxbridge job in neutron repo does,
resulting in sporadic timeouts of the job.

This patch also adds scenario-serial tox target and switches scenario
target to default concurrency too.

Change-Id: I76feb8f2f0415aeb1eae7242b74ae9668ff44ddf
Closes-Bug: #1660612
'}]
commit_message:
Execute full suite with default concurrency

We have full-serial to run those tests serially. Having full also
serial, we effectively ignore --concurrency argument that may be passed
with posargs, like neutron-tempest-linuxbridge job in neutron repo does,
resulting in sporadic timeouts of the job.

This patch also adds scenario-serial tox target and switches scenario
target to default concurrency too.

Change-Id: I76feb8f2f0415aeb1eae7242b74ae9668ff44ddf
Closes-Bug: #1660612

commit_message:
Switch from lib/neutron-legacy to lib/neutron

The patch switches gate jobs from old lib/neutron-legacy devstack
library to the new lib/neutron library.

Configure DVR if requested
Depends-On: I9f25921eefc5b935aad3bb1edc5e41ee0ce43a84

subject: Switched all jobs from q-qos to neutron-qos
messages:
[{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-11 19:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-12 06:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

note you need to change other repos as well, like networking-midonet or i18n - see http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=q-qos&i=nope&files=&repos='}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-01-12 08:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

networking-midonet is fine as far as q-qos alias will be kept until neutron-legacy support is dropped.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-12 18:11:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andreas, I think I have patches for all occurrences that don't explicitly use q-* base services (q-svc, q-meta...) In those other cases, I would like to follow up later when cleaning up lib/neutron-legacy. In the meantime, they can use old service names.

It's the occurrences where base services are not explicitly picked but q-qos or q-trunk is added to the list that I think we should fix right away before the default switch, because they automatically migrate to the new library then with the switch. Other repos need more work, preferrably after we switch.

The topic with other patches is: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:new-neutron-devstack-in-gate"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-12 19:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-19 19:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-19 20:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-01-28 11:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-04-04 20:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not in capacity to drive the effort forward.'}]

commit_message:
Switched all jobs from q-qos to neutron-qos

There is no functional difference between two in how devstack plugin for
neutron is implemented; but using neutron-* name pattern allows gate to
enable lib/neutron instead of lib/neutron-legacy devstack library to
deploy neutron services, which is the plan for all next releases.

Depends-On: I2fbd7649b6ef312940dca704ed3ebdb1e2e93576
Change-Id: Iab021b00df00e8ab645a02cd1c602d5bc5e4bcbe

2018-01-16 06:28:18.362394 | primary | 2018-01-16 06:28:18.361 | ImportError: No module named ovs_ofctl'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-18 05:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-19 20:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

as You can check on http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=ovs_ofctl&i=nope&files=&repos= modules like e.g. neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.openflow.ovs_ofctl are used in projects like networking-ovs-dpdk or networking-sfc (in tests). Shouldn't we warn them or propose changes to not break those repos with Your patch?"}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-24 05:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> as You can check on http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=ovs_ofctl&i=nope&files=&repos=
 > modules like e.g. neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.openflow.ovs_ofctl
 > are used in projects like networking-ovs-dpdk or networking-sfc (in
 > tests). Shouldn't we warn them or propose changes to not break
 > those repos with Your patch?

They are all test codes. Although I haven't looked in detail, I guess they can be dealt just like this patch does.
ovs-ofctl of_interface removal was decided in Denver and theoretically they should be aware of this. ;)"}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-25 06:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-26 00:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-26 18:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Workflow-1

Will need to wait for R.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-29 00:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> Will need to wait for R.

Sure. That sounds reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-02-15 01:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-02-16 12:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

There are out-of-tree users of the ovs_ofctl classes:

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=(from.*ovs_ofctl%7Covf_ofctl.*import)&i=nope&files=&repos='}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-02-16 12:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Perhaps consider two steps:
- rip off the option first
- look at the possible migration path for projects using the ovs_ofctl classes, then if doable mark them for deprecation, then remove them'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Precision to my previous comments: there is real (non test) code using the ovs_ofctl classes:
- networking-bagpipe
- networking-vsphere

Hence the -1: merging this as-is would at least break networking-bagpipe at once.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-03-01 05:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> Precision to my previous comments: there is real (non test) code
 > using the ovs_ofctl classes:
 > - networking-bagpipe
 > - networking-vsphere
 > 
 > Hence the -1: merging this as-is would at least break
 > networking-bagpipe at once.

The of_interface option has been deprecated since the start of Pike.
AFAIK, it's a stadium projects' responsibility to adapt such a change in the neutron core project."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-03-01 09:21:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> > Precision to my previous comments: there is real (non test) code
 > > using the ovs_ofctl classes:
 > > - networking-bagpipe
 > > - networking-vsphere
 > >
 > > Hence the -1: merging this as-is would at least break
 > > networking-bagpipe at once.
 > 
 > The of_interface option has been deprecated since the start of
 > Pike.
 > AFAIK, it's a stadium projects' responsibility to adapt such a
 > change in the neutron core project.

I agree with you.

To be precise, what networking-bagpipe depends on is *not* the of_interface option, but the ovs_ofctl implementation of the OVSTunnelBridge, which hadn't been marked for deprecation.

But yes, networking-bagpipe needs to adapt and stop depending on ovs_ofctl.
It's just that this change can't merge before networking-bagpipe is updated."}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-04-03 00:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

Hold this off until we come up with clearer future of ryu.
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-ryu-future-plans'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-04-04 20:50:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Seems like it's not going anywhere, and I am no longer interested / in capacity to move it forward. Feel free to revive the patch under your account if interested."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-28 18:48:30.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify description for q-agt service

It is not guaranteed to be Open vSwitch agent; other types of L2 agents
reuse the same service name (for example, Linuxbridge).

Change-Id: I664e462e810f3d919b335139e6f3f03be084fe19
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify description for q-agt service

It is not guaranteed to be Open vSwitch agent; other types of L2 agents
reuse the same service name (for example, Linuxbridge).

Change-Id: I664e462e810f3d919b335139e6f3f03be084fe19

[{'created': '2017-02-28 18:08:55.000000000', 'message': 'Expose lbaasv2 log in tempest-logs.html not lbaasv1

v1 jobs are mostly deprovisioned, and the API was killed in Ocata, v2 is
the supported way of lbaas deployment.

Change-Id: Icc76a9bf81c6953fc0a48945233893631194cdec
'}]
commit_message:
Expose lbaasv2 log in tempest-logs.html not lbaasv1

v1 jobs are mostly deprovisioned, and the API was killed in Ocata, v2 is
the supported way of lbaas deployment.

Change-Id: Icc76a9bf81c6953fc0a48945233893631194cdec

subject: Don't skip CLEAVED state when cleaving a root container
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 03:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-03 00:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Yeah, definitely like linearizing the states as much as possible.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-04 05:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 03:37:52.000000000', 'message': "Don't skip CLEAVED state when cleaving a root container

The CLEAVED state was introduced in the Related-Change [1].  Sharding
shard containers put their sub-shards to CLEAVED state after each is
cleaved. Sub-shards are moved to ACTIVE when they have all been
cleaved, at which time the sharding shard range is deleted.

While cleaving is in progress, the two states allow the original
ACTIVE shard range to be distinguished from new CLEAVED sub-shards
whose namespaces overlap with the original. Previously, shard ranges
in CLEAVED state were not used when a root container redirected
requests for listings, because they overlap with their 'parent' ACTIVE
shard range.

Conversely, when a root container is cleaving there is no existing
overlapping shard range and so the root moved cleaved shards directly
to the ACTIVE state so that they would be immediately available to use
for listings.

Since [2] the proxy controller can cope with overlapping shard ranges
when building concatenated listings. Both CLEAVED and overlapping
ACTIVE shard ranges can therefore be included when supplying shard
ranges for container listings.  This means that when a root container
knows of a CLEAVED shard range, it is able to provide it to the proxy
controller, allowing it to fetch a listing component directly from the
sub-shard. This also means that the same state transitions can be made
when cleaving both a root or a shard container.

[1] Related-Change: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
[2] Related-Change: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea
Change-Id: I1394bc1db3c438b4bece1ed526a06d5cb6ef2b4a

commit_message:
Don't skip CLEAVED state when cleaving a root container

The CLEAVED state was introduced in the Related-Change [1].  Sharding
shard containers put their sub-shards to CLEAVED state after each is
cleaved. Sub-shards are moved to ACTIVE when they have all been
cleaved, at which time the sharding shard range is deleted.

While cleaving is in progress, the two states allow the original
ACTIVE shard range to be distinguished from new CLEAVED sub-shards
whose namespaces overlap with the original. Previously, shard ranges
in CLEAVED state were not used when a root container redirected
requests for listings, because they overlap with their 'parent' ACTIVE
shard range.

Conversely, when a root container is cleaving there is no existing
overlapping shard range and so the root moved cleaved shards directly
to the ACTIVE state so that they would be immediately available to use
for listings.

Since [2] the proxy controller can cope with overlapping shard ranges
when building concatenated listings. Both CLEAVED and overlapping
ACTIVE shard ranges can therefore be included when supplying shard
ranges for container listings.  This means that when a root container
knows of a CLEAVED shard range, it is able to provide it to the proxy
controller, allowing it to fetch a listing component directly from the
sub-shard. This also means that the same state transitions can be made
when cleaving both a root or a shard container.

[1] Related-Change: I74df5085f999095a7d38444299abf12038e62d76
[2] Related-Change: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea
Change-Id: I1394bc1db3c438b4bece1ed526a06d5cb6ef2b4a

commit_message:
network: add command to configure trusted mode for VFs

By default, Virtual Functions have no privileges to perform certain
operations, such as enabling multicast promiscuous mode and modifying
the VFs MAC address in the guest. These security measures are designed
to prevent possible attacks, however, in some cases like failover
bonding these operations performed by a VF would be
legitimate.

This commit add command to enable/disable trust for a specific VF.

Implements blueprint sriov-trusted-vfs
Change-Id: I461fd97876e23cbf38ccb8d769a5c8173b8bc810

commit_message:
Disable automated cleaning in grenade

Grenade has seven nodes, and chances that at least one of them will
fail PXE booting is quite high. Ironic itself already has automated
cleaning disabled in its grenade jobs.

Change-Id: I89fab35848801ebd57a772fc4efa637cfb81844f

commit_message:
Move openstack-helm-multinode-(centos|fedora) to experimental pipeline

To help conserve resources move the centos / fedora multinode jobs
into the experimental pipeline. The will mean we are no longer using
10 nodes on every patchset.

These jobs have been non-voting for 3+ months, and will help reduce
the number of nodes needed by the helm project.

The jobs can still be run using 'check experimental' but now on
demand. And once they have been properly fixed can be moved back into
check / gate pipelines.

Change-Id: I6f5c6362749b7beb3e9f0ccff2b75d6b99d809d8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Fixes Neutron certificate and key permissions
messages: [{'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-04 02:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-04-04 02:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 02:11:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Neutron certificate and key permissions

The Neutron UID is not static and may be different between the host and
neutron container.  Since we generate certificates and keys on the host
for neutron and then mount them in a container, it is highly likely the
container Neutron UID will not match the one used on the host to
generate the files and reading these files will fail in the container.

This patch modifies the permissions after the files are mounted in the
container to be owned by the correct Neutron UID.

Closes-Bug: 1759049

Depends-On: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce

Change-Id: Ibad3f1af4b44459e96a6dc9937e5fcef3e6335f4
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 16731819c5bb92d9bb33c6fb8086a6a776bdef8c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Neutron certificate and key permissions

The Neutron UID is not static and may be different between the host and
neutron container.  Since we generate certificates and keys on the host
for neutron and then mount them in a container, it is highly likely the
container Neutron UID will not match the one used on the host to
generate the files and reading these files will fail in the container.

This patch modifies the permissions after the files are mounted in the
container to be owned by the correct Neutron UID.

Closes-Bug: 1759049

Depends-On: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce

Change-Id: Ibad3f1af4b44459e96a6dc9937e5fcef3e6335f4
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 16731819c5bb92d9bb33c6fb8086a6a776bdef8c)

This is the library and this is the relevant entry point.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-03-20 06:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Can you answer the questions here?
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/requirements/#for-new-requirements

Is the library actively maintained? Yes.
Is the library good code? Yes.
Is the library python 2 compatible? Yes.
Is the library python 3 compatible? Yes.
Is the library license compatible? Yes (Apache 2).
Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)? Not at the moment.
Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt? No.
Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? Yes.
Which one? Dragonflow (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518670/).
If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type? Independent.
Do I need to update anything else? No.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add skydive-client to global-requirements

This is required as Dragonflow is now using this library for topology
visualization (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518670/)
Library is maintatined at: https://github.com/skydive-project/skydive
Active IRC channel: #skydive-project
Compatibility: Python 2 / Python 3
License: Apache 2.0
After reviewing the code I believe it is a good one for OpenStack.
The library is available via pypi, but not yet via any distro packaging.

Other libraries (trollius 2.1 and asyncio 3.4.3 are required by skydive)

Change-Id: I89f37e9590de86ca8d6f6a48cf1673ea214b6d29

subject: tox: Get rid of excessive output when running unit tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-17 05:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-17 19:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I tested out --abbreviate locally and it takes 50% longer to run. (This is even worse that with the full subunit output, which only takes about 12.5% longer to run.)

I'm also not sure that in the gate it would update as regularly as you'd need, because there are no line breaks so it would probably get buffered somewhere. Also you can't tell which test is hanging.

Ideally there's be an easy way to always enable the subunit output, but only in the gate. I can't see one at the moment though."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-17 20:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-20 17:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This may soon be obsoleted by https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/pull/139'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Can be solved by:

  cat <<EOF >~/.stestr.yaml
  run:
    no-subunit-trace: True
  EOF'}]

This has been proposed before and I've also pushed back on it there; see I8c50a54f64a6ba91ccc46ecfefb50994d01d21f3.  On persistent builders, leaking mounts that may never go away is bad news. 

We need to determine what exactly is holding the mount open.

ISTR us discussing that maybe a wrapper around this that prints something helpful ... lsof output or similar ... might help us determine what's really holding the mount."}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-04 09:39:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I understand your concern and now agree with it. I currently have a system where all my attempts tp build an image fail due to the fact that 'dmsetup ls' command shows that all loop devices are still present and in use:
 dmsetup remove loop0p5
device-mapper: remove ioctl on loop0p5 failed: Device or resource busy
Command failed
However neither lsof nor fuser shows anything"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

could you paste the command and full logs?  often we see things in the exit path that are red herrings, and the real problem is somewhere else'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

As mentioned in his comment by Ian, this patchset makes no sense'}]

commit_message:
Fix umount error

Sometimes, at the very end of the image generation process you can get
an error like follows:

TS | subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'sudo umount /tmp/TMDIR/mnt/tmp'
	returned non-zero exit status 32
This patch fixes such issues.

Change-Id: I95fc24cd6117a62ad9554f5e8ff4fb5030f9b441

Strip API version from subsequent paginated links

keystoneauth1 is appending proper version prefix, therefore we must strip that when following subsequent page links.

commit_message:
Set MTU on OVS interfaces

Set the MTU for integration bridge, tunnel bridge and all the
physical bridges. This ensure OVS honor the MTU value configured
by cloud admins.

Change-Id: Iae0e110c7b7a2a1d15e68c4928f45a82f5edace0
Closes-Bug: #1745150

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 01:54:21.000000000', 'message': "Removes neutron ownership of certs

Since neutron UID is not static, setting the owners on the certificates
in the host to be 'neutron' will not match the UID for neutron in the
deployed container.  Therefore this patch removes the host neutron
ownership and leaves it as root, so that it can be later modified in the
container to be chowned to neutron.

Partial-Bug: 1759049

Change-Id: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fe09335418b45f6963645c018232530d517b2659)
"}]
commit_message:
Removes neutron ownership of certs

Since neutron UID is not static, setting the owners on the certificates
in the host to be 'neutron' will not match the UID for neutron in the
deployed container.  Therefore this patch removes the host neutron
ownership and leaves it as root, so that it can be later modified in the
container to be chowned to neutron.

Partial-Bug: 1759049

Change-Id: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fe09335418b45f6963645c018232530d517b2659)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 02:19:00.000000000', 'message': "[placement] api-ref: Fix parameters

This patch fixes the following items.

* GET /resource_providers

  Wrong order of query parameters.
  They should be sorted by microversion order.

* POST /resource_providers

  A required parameter is defined as optional.
  Set it as required.

* GET /allocation_candidates

  The 'member_of' parameter is available from microversion 1.21.
  But it is defined as being available from microversion 1.3.
  So fix it.

Change-Id: I66c9608cd6b4a938ca7f8450d4130e942360a9f0
Closes-Bug: #1760520
"}, {'created': '2018-04-03 08:10:25.000000000', 'message': '[placement] api-ref: Fix parameters

* GET /resource_providers

Closes-Bug: #1760520
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] api-ref: Fix parameters

This patch fixes the following items.

* GET /resource_providers

  Wrong order of query parameters.
  They should be sorted by microversion order.

* POST /resource_providers

  A required parameter is defined as optional.
  Set it as required.

Change-Id: I66c9608cd6b4a938ca7f8450d4130e942360a9f0
Closes-Bug: #1760520

Remove kwargs_to_fetch_token

kwargs_to_fetch_token was deprecated and should be
removed in Rocky now.

Change-Id: Ic247efb84c5133449ead6a9864bbd7748e5e74bd

commit_message:
Set min-ready for fedora-26 to 0

Start the process of removing fedora-26 nodes from nodepool.  This
will happen over a series of commits.

Change-Id: I5fac84e9d21817438ba1561e8c609bd856d07985
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deallocate the VIP prior to deleting the amphorae

This patch changes the load balancer delete flow order to deallocate the VIP
port(s) prior to deleting the amphorae. This resolves an issue where an
initial delete fails due to a neutron outage.

Change-Id: Ifcfdba1d28aa732d0f7b3b0a8bffb58cee0ab7cc
Story: 2001523
Task: 6325

commit_message:
Update install guides

- Ensure myproject and myuser are used throughout the guide
consistently
- Add note that connection's host in keystone.conf must be resolveable

Change-Id: Icaaf6c1b7583ed75b7a6204d7fb1f3506e4e8937
